  3. This product broke within less than a year. Don't recommend.
  4. BF wanted it to shave his head weekly, the reviews seemed great but once he got it and used it, the shave on his head wasnt so good, left a little buzz cut .... it shaves the face nice though.
  5. I have been using this shaver for several months now and I like it very much. It stays charged for a long while between charges and cuts very well. The trimmer is excellent and use it to trim stray hairs wherever I need it. I would purchase this item again.
  6. This razor is great until water ruins your button and the LCD. I have to return mine to the factor for repair.. So it has a defect if you use it for wet shaving often.
  7. it works. I use it everyday. the only complaint is that I have to spend 10-15 minutes every morning to get a clean shave. I think the manufacturers need to work on a better product to provide a tool that will do the job in 5 minutes. This comes down to finding a solution for a blade that can stay sharp or a blade(s) that can be sharpened. I find myself having to go over an area several times before it completely catches everything. If you go over an area too much you may run the risk in slightly breaking the skin.
  8. This razor gives me the closest shave I have ever had, and that includes electric and blade! I really like the convenience of shaving in the shower. I even dropped it on the floor once, and it was not damaged at all. This is the best razor I have ever purchased.
  9. My boyfriend loved it! Painless and super easy to clean.
  10. I like the design. Very quick and comfortable shave, especially in the neck area.
  11. Was delivered promptly and exactly as described. I'm really enjoying having the shaver, works great.
  12. Best there is. Smooth long lasting shave. Power lasts forever. Easy to clean under tap once a week. Fits my hand, chin and face. A heavy duty shaver.
  13. This Panasonic was a revelation to my face as it shaves a lot closer than the B***n I was using. It is also faster by far & more comfortable. I was using a B***n before I got this Panasonic. It came with a cleaning device but you had to keep buying their solution to go with it. This is cleaned by using soap/water and holding the switch more than two seconds, nothing else to buy. This Pope loves it!<br /><br />Erik The Pope
  14. I've used this Panasonic ES8243A only once, and I already love it. I've always used electric razors (Remington and Panasonic), rather than conventional blade razors, and this model is the best I've experienced so far. I use the razor on my legs and underarms, and I have medium-coarse hair (rather than coarse, like on a man's face). Surprisingly, this Panasonic gave me a smooth-as-silk finish. I had to go over the areas 2-3 times, in order to get it totally smooth. But who cares? I had to do the same thing with all of my electric razors in the past. This razor gave me a painless shave (no tugging or discomfort at all), its head bends side-to-side, as well as front-to-back, which make it easy to conquer my knees and other tough spots. I highly recommend this razor after using it once. I'll update this review after more use, if my opinion changes. For now, it's awesome.
  15. It works well so far- very powerful. I've used it wet, and I have little irritation post-shave. It doesn't cut as closely as my DSC razors, but what would? It's the best electric I've used so far. I would recommend it to anyone looking to move back to an electric, or upgrade from a cheaper model.
  16. The shaver works just as good as as the reviews stated! Easy to use ready to clean, stays charged for several uses... I would recommend to buy ...
  17. This shaver is noisy in comparison with my old Panasonic 8066. Also not as substantial as my old shaver. First issue I encountered was the lack of a travel lock switch - I think the only Panasonic shaver not to have one - which is odd given the shaver comes with a travel pouch. Second issue is my thumb sometimes switches off the shaver when shaving as the switch is close to the thumb rest.<br />But the shaver does give a good close shave and I'm happy with it. So a good shaver at a reasonable price.

  20. I bought this because I hate to shave with a regular razor. I was immediately impressed with the power of this thing. I have another electric trimmer that I use for trimming my neck or when I let my beard grow for about a week, and it is put to shame by the power of this Panasonic. I get a very close shave with this razor and it is easy to clean. It also has a very good battery life. It typically takes me about 3 minutes to shave with this razor (the display shows you how long you shave), and the battery lasts long enough that I almost forget that it needs charging since it is weeks before I have to re-charge it. I do not shave every day, but probably every 3-4 days. I am sold on Panasonic now. I doubt this thing ever breaks, but if I ever need another one, I will buy another just like it.
  21. Wishes came true with this shaver, but I wished it were corded too!!!!I for get to plug it in sometimes...
  22. Update: 09/19/14<br /><br />I Am on my second razor since this purchase. The first razor developed an issue with the led display screen where everything started lighting up. I contacted Panasonic and had a warrant RMA issued. You have to pay to ship it to Panasonic and you will be without the razor for about a month. Anyway, I received the replacement, or repaired, razor from Panasonic and within three months the led display started going crazy again. Although the razor still works great for shaving, the display is now completely useless to me since it flashes every possible icon when the razor is activated. I leave my razor in the shower on a shelf, so maybe water has infiltrated both units and caused the display issues. If that is the case, then this product is not completely waterproof. Since it still works for the intended purpose, I've just learned to live with the bonked display and simply charge it every Saturday to ensure it is charged. Others might consider thoroughly drying it off and storing it outside of the shower, but it is too late for that in my case and I don't intend to go another month without a razor just to have a working led display again.<br /><br />Original review:<br />I've been using various Norelco rotary shavers for more than 25 years and I thought that I was always pleased with them. They worked decently, but I never felt it was as close a shave as the commercials made them out to be, especially along the neck. I always found that it would just miss hairs along the front sides and the very middle of the neck. So, I figured it was time to try a foil shaver, but I wanted one that could be used in the shower as well...unlike all of my old Norelcos.<br /><br />I did lots of research and read way too many reviews on Amazon as well as blogs and discussion site. I narrowed it down to two Panasonic shavers and one Braun. I then eliminated the Braun because of the need for cleaning cartridges. I didn't want to have to purchase things just to clean the shaver. That left me between this Panasonic and the more expensive ESLA63S. I wasn't sure about the size of the head on the ESLA63S, so I decided on this model. And once Amazon lowered the price and provided a $15 coupon before Father's Day, I just had to pull the trigger.<br /><br />First impressions:<br /><br />1) It is heavier than any Norelco I've ever had.<br />2) It is about twice as loud as any Norelco I've ever had.<br />3) My first attempt was as a dry shaver, and it proved to shave a little bit closer than the Norelcos...especially along my neck. All of those stray hairs on my neck disappeared.<br />4) Every subsequent attempt has been as a wet shaver, and this is where this shaver truly shines. For a week now, I have the closest shave I've ever had and my face actually feels smooth now.<br />5) I've had a new small area of razor burn with each shave thus far, but that is to be expected when switching to a completely different shaving system. Just upgrading from older Norelco to a newer Norelco usually had the same result for the first week or two and I expect this Panasonic to be the same until my face gets used to the new system.<br /><br />I am now left wondering why I didn't switch sooner. Great product Panasonic...and great price Amazon. I just love Prime!gs just to clean the shaver. That left me between this Panasonic and the more expensive ESLA63S. I wasn't sure about the size of the head on the ESLA63S, so I decided on this model. And once Amazon lowered the price and provided a $15 coupon before Father's Day, I just had to pull the trigger.<br /><br />First impressions:<br /><br />1) It is heavier than any Norelco I've ever had.<br />2) It is about twice as loud as any Norelco I've ever had.<br />3) My first attempt was as a dry shaver, and it proved to shave a little bit closer than the Norelcos...especially along my neck. All of those stray hairs on my neck disappeared.<br />4) Every subsequent attempt has been as a wet shaver, and this is where this shaver truly shines. For a week now, I have the closest shave I've ever had and my face actually feels smooth now.<br />5) I've had a new small area of razor burn with each shave thus far, but that is to be expected when switching to a completely different shaving system. Just upgrading from older Norelco to a newer Norelco usually had the same result for the first week or two and I expect this Panasonic to be the same until my face gets used to the new system.<br /><br />I am now left wondering why I didn't switch sooner.   23. Where this razor excels is using it in the shower. It does an ok job as a dry razor but I can get a razor blade shave without the skin irritation as a wet shaver. I have discovered by going a step further that using a little soap on my face made my razor glide like cats on a smooth surface.

  25. I would buy this product again. This shaver works great in the shower or when used with a pre shave product.
  26. Close as a blade with no cuts. Even mows down my barbed wire stubble with ease. Easy to use and clean; I highly recommend for those that hate the blade.
  27. I have never been a fan of Electric razors, but this one is great. The best thing I can say is it actually works. I charge it once every few weeks and it is fine for me. It works around my goatee with no issue at all (I worried it would be too bulky). I mostly use it to shave dry and I have not had any burns or irritations. I strongly recommend this razor.
  28. Great product and I highly recommend this to any one.
  29. Before I ordered this product, I read several of the reviews on Amazon for this product. I must admit, when I read people raving about products, I am usually a little skeptical. Well, the razor arrived and I read the instruction and charged it. So far, so good. The next morning I used it to shave for the first time. What an amazing result! I could not believe how close the shave was! Plus the discomfort I had felt with my previous razor was gone. The next shave was better still; less time, closer and more comfortable. Now a month later and the results are even better. Using the razor wet gives me the very best result plus the bonus that I can clean it every time. Overall this is the best electric razor I have ever owned and almost as good as the best non-electric. Just buy one, you will not be disappointed.
  30. Thought this would be an awesome shaver after reading all the reviews. However, it doesn't shave all that close on my neck even after four weeks of use. Also, it tends to smell as if it's burning. I think it's just the fast action of the blades though. I would probably look else where for my next shaver.
  31. I have to say, I'm a sceptic, so when I saw all the rave reviews of this shaver on here, I thought, \\"Oh, it couldn't be that good.\\" Well, it is! I've owned Braun electric shavers previously, which I thought were the Audis or Mercedes of the electric shaver world. The Panasonic ES 8243A Arc IV (long and dumb name, by the way!) is just amazing. I've owned it for 7 weeks now. It took a few weeks to get used to it, as reported on here. I have to say, that I've never been able to get as close a shave as I do with this shaver. It rivals a straight-blade shave, truly. Following the reviews on here, I started out using it in the shower, as a wet shaver. But, now, I don't bother with that and find I get an equally close shave prior to taking a shower. Either way, this shaver is just perfection and so easy to clean-up, too. Thank you, Panasonic, for truly designing and making a shaver that lives up to its hype.
  32. I am 31 years old. This is my first shaver. It meets my expectations in every area. It shaves very good and,fast and does not irritate my skin.
  33. Bought this as a replacement for a Braun - wish I'd never wasted $ on the Braun. This one is quieter, more comfortable & shaves better.
  34. The Winner Is... The Panasonic ES8109S 3-blade - barely. Put the Remington blades and cutter (keeping the center blade of the Panasonic) on a Panasonic 13,000 RPM shaver and you would have the World's best electric shaver. The Remington shaved a little closer than the Panasonic and provided a faster shave. However, the difficulty in cleaning, noise and lack of a charging base tipped me to the Panasonic as the final choice. This is a review of three Panasonic models; ES8243A (4-blade), ES8109S (3-blade) and ES7109, the Remington MS2-390, the Norelco 8260 CC and the Braun Series 5 8995 (8985 & 8975 only differ in displays and cleaning). I have an average beard and have been using electric shavers (foils and rotaries) over 30 years. The models here are no better than any of the other higher quality shavers I've owned. It takes about 10 minutes (no shaver will give you a first-pass close shave) to get to that good dry shave (with or without pre-electric gels/oils) and you do have to put pressure on to get a close shave. This means recharging every 4-5 days. Gels/oils do make the process easier - not faster - and I have reviewed six of them on their Amazon sites. ES8109S: This 3-blade shaver gives a very close shave, with some work. It does give off a higher pitch `whine', while shaving, that is somewhat annoying, but is not what I would consider noisy. Nor is the cleaning operation noisy. Based upon other reviewers, I was expecting it to sound like a lawn mower, but it is just an occasional buzzing noise as it cleans. The \\"Arc Foil\\" design slows shaving (see discussion, below). ES8243A: I had hoped that the four blades of the Panasonic ES8243A just might be able to give a superior shave. As it turns out, the large four-blade surface is like trying to keep the end of a 2x4 on your face. It makes cutting in the areas where you don't have a lot of skin area (chin, jaw line, upper lip, base of sideburns, etc) more difficult. In fact, I think that the fourth blade in the middle actually interferes with a better shave and these two middle blades are not as good as the primary cutters. The \\"Arc Foil\\" design makes it even slower (see discussion, below). Another future problem with the 4-blade system is that you'll want to buy a new shaver when your blades and foil need to be replaced. What kind of an idiot is going to spend 80% of the cost of a new shaver just to get a set of new cutter blades and foil? All in all: the ES8243A 4-blade is a poor value. ES7109S: The flat design of the foil is a better design than the \\"Arc Foil\\" (see below). Unfortunately, this shaver has an under-powered motor and the floating head that cannot be locked. Panasonic discussion: Panasonic had developed an outstanding shaver line some ten years ago. My old ES8067 still shaves closer than this new \\"NANO Technology\\"- a misnomer (marketing gimmick). I think the reason is that Panasonic's older models came with cutting blades with the individual blades having been about half the width of all of Panasonic's newer cutting blades (including replacements). This means more surface area on the newer blades and that means less cutting. Remington has the ideal blades (that Panasonic used to make) and it shows in closer cutting and less time spent doing so. Additionally, these new Panasonic \\"Arc Foil\\" shavers have the foil curving AWAY from your face at the ends of the foil, further decreasing exposure to the blades and requiring many more passes to cover the same area. Unfortunately, Panasonic puts their better motor (13,000 RPMs) only on these ill-conceived \\"Arc Foil\\" designs. Battery time on the Panasonics is the shortest of all shavers reviewed here. The Panasonic trimmers are so narrow, on all of these models, that you will not be able to trim sideburns with one attempt. You will have to re-position the trimmer to get what you missed. This increases the probability that you will get an uneven sideburn. The Remington MS2-390 has the blades that thePanasonics should have (and did have years ago): flat foil area (not \\"Arc Foiled\\"), good length (25% longer) and ultra thin cutting blades. As a result, closeness of the shave is better and time spent is shorter. This is, however, the loudest (and it is loud) of all shavers and there are no bells and whistles. Using a pre-shave oil/gel will gum up the blades, as with any shaver, but these blades pop off with even the slightest brushing so be prepared to watch them fall into the sink with every cleaning attempt. A charging stand would greatly increase the convenience of this shaver. Remington did a poor job with the details. The Braun Series 5 8995 tries hard (you can hear noticeable slowing when necessary pressure is applied, like a lawn mower when it reaches thicker grass), but it doesn't get quite as close as the Panasonics or Remington without leaving a stronger burning sensation after the shave. The Braun can also leave burn marks and even cuts (nose and lips) that will bleed. Odd: you would think that, with it getting so close as to actually burn the skin, it would also give a closer shave. I suppose this is proof that shavers cannot \\"lift\\" hairs to cut better. Additionally, the design of the handle is inferior, making positioning more difficult. It does have a much wider trimmer and longer battery life between charges, though. The Norelco 8260 CC: I used this rotary-type of shaver for many years during the 80's. I switched to foil and found I could get a closer shave. This is still the case. Additionally, because of the circular blades, it is somewhat difficult to target certain spots for cleanup. However, this is the quietest shaver. PS: don't accept the nonsense about giving your face 30 days to adjust, unless you are coming off a blade. If you are accustomed to an electric shaver, you only need a week or two to determine the difference. The only thing magical about 30 days is that you can no longer return it for a refund - what a coincidence!
  35. I am a repeat Panasonis customer who knows how quick and close their shavers cut. Unfortunately the last model I owned had a defective battery and no replacement batteries could be found. I hope this problem has been resolved by the manufactture or this will be my last shaver by Panasonic.
  36. Lets start by saying I hate shaving... My \\"beard\\" is more like a bunch of miscellaneous fuzz and hair that grows at weird angles than anything else. I was using a Mach 3 and the blades lasted for a couple shaves, I cut myself all the time, and my skin was always red and irritated later. Lots of people suggested this cream that lotion and who knows what else. Nothing I tried helped much besides shelling out $$$$$ for fresh blades. Enter the ES8243A.... I read a lot of the reviews here, and as reluctant as I was to spend so much on a shaver, I pushed the button and soon an amazon box showed up at the door. Well, what can I say... I'm a believer. It's worth the $, it really is that good. First time I tried it there was a definite improvement in the irritation department. I decided it was a keeper, and I would also see if there was an improvement over time as the card in the box suggests there will be. I wouldn't call it dramatic, but after a few weeks it seems that has gotten easier/quicker to shave with it. Part of it might just be getting used to which angle works best on each part of your face, but it does seem to be able to cut closer now. ----------------------- Some other things I'll mention: I don't mind having to clean it, portability was a main concern for me and I did not want to be tied down to a base station. If you always stay at home and are in a rush I suppose the version with the cleaning station is nice, but you will be buying cartridges for that as well. Cost wise, the ridiculous pricing and short life of standard razor blades means you will not be spending as much on this as you think you are. I'm not sure how long the foils will last yet, but so far it works like the day I got it. One of my favorite things is the consistency. With a standard razor, you put on a new blade and it's just straight downhill from there. Every day the shave gets worse until you can't take it anymore and replace it. With the Panasonic, its the same everytime. Battery charges fast and lasts a long time. I tend to plug it in around 50% and it's usually done by the time I take a shower and get dressed.
  37. If you are not use to using an electric razor and have light to normal facial hair, I would not recommend an electric razor at all. You must go over the same spot many times, tolerate a constant pulling feeling and be left with many hairs that have laid down and have hidden from the blades. It might be a good electric razor but not good if you are looking to get a close shave.

  39. My husband really likes this product. He says it gives a close shave without irritation. He would recommend it to future customers.
  40. This is by far the best shaver I have ever owned. It shaves as close as a blade when used wet and with shave lotion -- I used superslick by billy jealousy.
  41. I wanted something waterproof, and it was sharp as heck the 1st 2 weeks but then got a little dull. For the price its ok, Ive had it for maybe 3 months now. The display is a little off but maybe thats because i was charging it overseas. Not amazing but worth it for a cool shaver/ with display that is water proof.
  42. The Panasonic ES8243A is the best shaver I have ever used!!! Have used this shaver since October 2009. I have a heavy beard (shave twice a day)and have used electric shavers for 50 years (Remington, Norelco, Braun, Pansonic, you name it). The ES8243A is quiet, comfortable, a fast charge, easy to use, easy to clean and gives a fast, smooth, close shave with no burns or chaffing. No hassle purchase through Amazon at a great price and with fast \\"regular\\" shipping. I no longer dread shaving...and I don't have to use a \\"blade\\" to follow up my electric shave. Highly, highly recommend this product!!!
  43. I was using a Norelco shaver with 3 heads for about 8 years. I started to develop severe irritation on my face and that's when I realized it was time for a new shaver. Since I shave pretty much every day, I figured a shaver is a good item to invest a little money in so i purchased this one. I also liked the fact that I could shave wet because I wanted to in order to eliminate the irritation my face had from the Norelco dry process. So I purchased this and some [[ASIN:B00005U8WT Neutrogena Men Skin Clearing Shave Cream - 5.1 fl oz]] and although it didn't help at first, it ended up not only completely clearing my skin, but I also get a much better shave. The bottom-line difference is that this product's motor is much stronger than the Norelco and therefore it does not slow down when it is shaving longer hair or hits a thick patch. It's quite amazing to watch this thing shave a thick beard without even slowing at all actually. My only complaint is that I seem to get cut more by this thing but that may be a technique thing and something I need to get used to. It's probably just because the shaver is so much stronger.
  44. Works about as good as any other razor I've had... but like all the other ones, it takes about 30 strokes to get all the small hairs on the neck.
  45. So, I'm a Jew with curly hair and have had problems with ingrown hairs on my neck ever since I started shaving. Regular razors caused me to get them all the time. So, I switched to this product called Bump Patrol, which is made specifically to prevent ingrown hairs. That didn't help. I struggled through that for a couple years, eventually deciding to just maintain a five-o'clock shadow. Now, I have a job and have to shave daily. That is where this comes in. I started using it a few weeks ago, and I am yet to get an ingrown hair on my neck. It's a miracle. While the shave isn't as close as it could be on the neck, I can deal with it. I'd rather have a not-too-close shave than unsightly ingrown hairs. I can't attest as to whether this electric razor is better than other razors in this regard, but I can say that it gets the job done for me. Finally, cleaning this thing has been very easy. Just detach the foil and run it under water with a little bit of soap. Voila. As this is so easy, I would recommend this over any self-cleaning razor. Self-cleaning seems like a gimmick and a way for the manufacturer to continue to make money off you after you buy the razor.
  46. I've had this razor for about five months now. It gives me a smooth shave and requires no real upkeep. I think I've had to recharge it only twice. I keep the plastic guard on the top when it's not in use; haven't had problems with the top getting dented (even though I travel with it).

  52. I've used electric shavers for many years. Started with numerous Braun models and have been using a couple of different Remington models for the past 8-9 years.   53. After spending $20 - $200 on electric shavers over the past several years, this is the best one I've ever had.
  54. I am not one for writing reviews, but feel compelled to do so in this case. I bought this razor approximately 4 weeks ago and am absolutely thrilled by the results I have achieved! I have owned many electric razors over the years: Norelco, Remington, and, most recently, Brauns. But the Panasonic ES8243A (ARC IV) is far and away the best I've ever used! After charging it for the first time, I wanted to try a \\"wet\\" shave. So, I found an old can of shaving cream and \\"lathered up.\\" All I can say is, WOW! The shave was great and closer than any I had achieved with an electric and quite comparable to a regular razor. I used regular and gel shave creams in my experiments and the shaver worked well with both. I have since used it primarily as a \\"dry\\" shaver and experienced similar results: very smooth and almost effortless. The thing I hated about both of my Braun shavers was that I had to make multiple passes over the same areas to achieve \\"passable\\" results. With the Panasonic, I make fewer passes and get a closer shave; even in those difficult areas. I do have to press a little harder than I'm used to, but have not had any problems with razor burn at all (can't say the same for my Brauns - press too hard and lots of irritation). Whether you're shaving wet or dry, clean up is easy and can be done in about a minute. My only \\"complaint\\" is that it does not come with a travel case. It's not a deal breaker, but would be nice to keep the razor and charger together when traveling. All-in-all, I have nothing but praise for the Panasonic ARC IV (ES8243A) and have no problem recommending it highly.
  55. Wonderful shave and battery lasts weeks without charging.
  56. Previously used a Braun 7000 series. Had it own cleaning system for which you had to continue buying expensive cartridges. The Panasonic gives a better, closer shave and you just rinse it off!
  57. The only electric shaver I've ever owned that could cut a week old beard without tearing the whiskers out of my face. Very comfortable to use and easy to clean. Have been useing for over a month with no problems.
  58. In the past I have bought Norelco razors, and when my last one gave out I thought that I would give Panasonic a try. I read a lot of positive reviews for this razor and have always had good luck with Panasonic products. I am very happy with the performance of the razor. I have a fairly tough beard and like other razors, you still have to go over more than once and hit it from different directions, but it does a good job. I do like the ability to clean the razor with water and a charge lasts me about 6 shaves. It is a little loud, but overall I Tam very pleased with the product and I have had it for over 3 months.
  59. I placed an order for this supposed \\"fabulous\\" Panasonic ES8243A with nano technology last November, so nowadays I have been using this shaver for about 30 days. I have a 10 year experience using rechargeable shavers, specifically Philips-Noreclo rotary system. First of all, my beard is very light, so for any rechargeable shaver cutting and shaving is really easy. Particularly, I don´t understand how in earth this model has obtained the best qualifications in such important magazines as Consumers Reports. In my opinion, shaving with this Panasonic is about average, is very difficult to shave in the areas surrounding your neck and nearby the Adam´s Apple, I must finish cutting some damn hairs with my ancient rotary Philips shaver. Shaving in other parts of the face such as cheeks,chin,and mustache is quick and comfortable. PROS: 1) Very light structure, nice to handle. 2) Good looking color,very nice shaver. 3) Very close & smooth shave only at the face. 4) Easy clean up, pop the shaver heads & rinse under water and soap. 5) Charges fast. Cool digital readouts for charging status & battery. 6) Can use it in the shower. 7) Can use dry or with shaving cream / gel. 8) Made In Japan, a rare thing to see nowadays. CONS: 1) Not quite the perfect shave Panasonic is proud to announce compared with other brands such as Philips and Braun 2) Very big cutting heads, difficult to move around face´s contour and curves. 3) Battery life is short (5 days average use) 4) Can cause some irritation 5) Loud noise 6) Low cutting effect in the neck In resume I prefer the efficient rotary system patented about 30 years ago by Philips, for me this system is smoother, quieter and faster. Don´t loose your money, buy directly the new Philips - Norelco models offer here at Amazon.
  60. In the past I've used a Braun foil-type shaver and a Philips/Norelco rotary shaver (which Continental Airlines was recently so kind as to lose for me). Of all the ones I've used, my new Panasonic is the first one that actually does a good job on my neck, and doesn't leave patches that simply refuse to be shaved. It's also fast -- I find that to get a really good shave I have to make two passes (which takes under five minutes, all told) but even a single pass is still respectable: no patches, just a not-quite-perfectly-smooth shave. Cleaning is also a million times easier than the rotary kind, and there's no need to spend money on the \\"cleaning station\\" version -- just clean with water, and maybe rubbing alcohol from time to time. So really, the other reviews aren't making things up. This shaver works nicely.

I will even shave my 5:00 shadow.
  63. I have used Bruan shavers for over 10 years, but have recently been disappointed with the results. Plus this unit is made & designed so well, it's a joy to use. The Braun's are going onto Freecycle today.....
  64. I will start off by saying that I tried an electric razor when I first started shaving in high school. That lasted for about a week and I haven't touched one until I bought this. I am now in my 30's.<br /><br />The Good:<br />This razor does shave very close. Before this I used a Mach 3 and it shaves just as close as that one does. It is very easy to use the functionality of the razor, as well as clean it. The display is just fine as it will tell you the percentage of battery left (just percent, not time left) as well as the amount of time that your current shave was, and whether or not you should clean the razor or plug it in. The plug it in notification seems pretty pointless to me considering it tells you how much juice you have left in the battery too!<br /><br />The Bad:<br />Like I said in the good, it gives me a good shave. That is, where it works. I don't know if it is my skin, or the shape of my face or what, but I just can't seem to have it shave close everywhere. There are always patches of stray hairs that are left. The head of the razor is really large. This causes you to be very precise if you have a beard/goatee/mustache, etc. It is hard to get it exactly right as your vision is blocked. It does have the trimmer, but that won't quite do the job.<br /><br />The battery life is not as advertised! I think it said something like 14, 3-minute shaves on one battery charge. I spend anywhere from 3-5 minutes each shave and I get maybe 5 shaves out of it (that is on a lucky charge). That being said, it charges very fast, and its not a big deal seeing that I always have an outlet nearby when using it (and if I didn't, I think the 4-5 shaves would hold me over until I could get to an outlet). Just don't take this on a month long camping trip!<br /><br />Overall, I find this to be an okay razor. It doesn't completely turn me off to electric razors again (as the one I used when I was younger did). The biggest overall downside for me was the size of the head. Sure, it might seem to give you a faster shave because you are covering more area, but next time, I will try to find something a bit smaller.to give you a faster shave because you are covering more area, but next time, I will try to find something a bit smaller.
  65. Very cool looking razor, but didn't shave worth a dime. Wet/dry function worked as expected, but didn't shave worth a dime. Battery display and cleaning notifier worked great but... did I mention it didn't shave worth a dime?! I wanted to love this razor, but the $60 norelco that gave out prior to me buying this one at more than double the price was WAY better than this hunk of junk. My fiancee continually asked if I had shaved and/or pointed out many, many missed hairs when I used this razor. I really gave it a shot folks... Used it for 3 months, thinking it's gotta get better soon. Nope! ...And dull or poorly set blades weren't the problem as this thing nicked me up pretty well a number of times when I was pressing very hard, which is a whole different story. The short of it is,as my title simply says, this thing sucked... For me that is. I recognize that this may not be the case for everyone. I bought this thing after reading all of the great reviews, so I was completely shocked it was just this bad. To give a little more detail, there may be some other factors to consider before deciding, to buy or not to buy. It didn't work for me, so here are a few variables to consider about my situation: 1) I'm black and probably have softer than normal facial hair 2) I'm not very hairy at all 3) I only used this shaver as a wet shaver with shaving gel or foam 4) I only shaved with it while in a hot shower While I don't see why any of these things would make a bit of difference, perhaps they do. I don't make a fuss about things too often, but when you pay this much money for something and it's completely ineffective at it's sole purpose, it kinda ruffles your feathers. I'll be buying the newest norleco which is equally as expensive and is also receiving great reviews. I'll let you know about that one in a couple of months. I also want to note that I gave this razor to friend, so I'll be sure to update this with his comments in the near future.

  69. I did a lot of research (over several months) before deciding on a Panasonic. I bought this model thinking it had all the features I was looking for. All the plastic that makes up the head of the razor is so thin and flimsy it felt like something you might buy from a dollar store. Even the base felt like cheap plastic. I wonder what would happen if this ever fell to the floor. I charged it over night and tried it the next day. Again not liking the feel of all the thin plastic but, if it gave a good shave maybe I could over look it. Well it didn't offer any better shave than my 2003 model Braun with 2 blades. And it pulled at my beard like I would expect from a rotary. It was as if it was plucking hairs from my face. At that point I knew this was going back. I cleaned it and packed it up the next day and sent it back to Amazon. I'll never buy another Panasonic razor.

  72. I rarely write reviews, but feel compelled to share my experience. I have been shaving with the most modern Gillette and Schick razors for 42 years. I decided to buy this Panasonic to keep at the office for a touch-up dry shave prior to evening events. I liked the Panasonic so much I brought it home and have used it every morning in a wet shave for the past two weeks. It takes me 3 minutes and 15 seconds for a wet shave - about the same time with a razor. I am amazed that my results are better than a razor! When pressing the Panasonic harder it easily removes stubborn hairs in dimples and at the base of my neck. Best of all, no more nicks and cuts. I can throw away my styptic pencil. If I had previously known this type of quality shave was available with an electric, I would have switched sooner. Tip: My dermatologist suggested that I not use regular soap on my face; instead, he suggested Clearasil Daily Face Wash. It is more expensive than regular soap but does a great job - not gritty. I shave looking into a mirror over the sink. I first wash my face with my hands and lathered Clearasil. Instead of using shaving creams or gels I shave with the wet Clearasil still on my face. If I feel the Panasonic needs rinsing I simply rinse the heads under running water and return to shaving. Result: clean face, very close shave, and save expenses of shaving gels and styptic pencil. Works well for me. Hope my experience is good for you. I highly recommend this Panasonic electric shaver.

  78. I am a bit biased when it comes to electric razors. Partly because I have extremely sensitive skin plus a very heavy beard and partly because of some terrible experiences with electric razors in the past. I tried Remington one time and it tore my up my skin. I tried Braun and my face and skin loved it, but my wallet couldn't afford it. So I trust Panasonic, went for their pitch and shelled out the money for this mid-range razor. Well, it did not disappoint. Perhaps the Braun was a little bit better of a shave, but the Panasonic is more than up to the task. I especially love the linear motor – which as I understand it, keeps the blades moving at the same speed even though the battery may be low. This cuts down on pulling your whiskers and otherwise irritating you skin. It is completely submersible so using it in the shower is just fine. I use mine dry and use the Shave Stick Powder by Remington. I know other reviewers have said nothing beats a wet razor shave, but I have to say this Panasonic shaves me just as close as a blade and shave cream. Cleaning is a snap since all you do is put a drop of liquid soap on it and run it under running water. It takes me about six minutes to shave and that uses about 20% of the battery. So that would give me five days of shaves. Not too bad, not spectacular, but like I said I have a very tough beard to plow through. Watch your prices on Amazon, I have seen the price fluctuate 30% or more in just one day. I believe in Amazon and prefer to purchase through them, but not if it’s going to cost me $20+ more. The only con I can think of with this razor is it does not have the induction recharging that they had on earlier models. Not only was it cool but you didn’t have to worry about sticking a live electrical wire into a potentially went charging receptacle. Overall this razor rates 5-stars (probably more if I could give it). It does what it is supposed to do, it does it well and it is worth what I paid for it. I will always chose Panasonic in the future based on this and other Panasonic product. Please remember this is just one person’s opinion. If you buy the Panasonic ES8243A razor, I hope you have as delightful a shaving experience as I did!onic in the future based on this and other Panasonic product. Please remember this is just one person’s opinion. If you buy the Panasonic ES8243A razor, I hope you have as delightful a shaving experience as I did!

  81. I bought this unit 9 months ago and intended to write a positive review all along. But, 3 days ago, it started acting up on me. The display shows all 8:88 for time and lights up all indicators solid. If I put it on the charger, it seems to reset and work properly after it reaches 100% charge. After the 1st shave, it displays correctly, but goes wonky again after the 2nd shave.<br /><br />Up until this malfunction, I have been happy with the unit overall. I previously only used Phillips/Norelco models with the 3 circular blades and only the wet/dry models priced under $100. These were previously the only ones that didn't make my neck red after use. I decided to try this Panasonic model after reading reviews that led me to believe it might be a faster, closer shave than with my previous Phillips/Norelco models without causing me discomfort.<br /><br />I was right, for the most part. I found my shaving time was cut nearly in half and the shave seemed to be closer. It did, however, make my neck red if I wasn't careful to keep plenty of shaving gel on my neck. But, it didn't feel uncomfortable when it happened and was back to normal within about 20 minutes. Also, it did actually cut me a few times when I went over the Adams apple.<br /><br />The biggest problem I have is it is rather noisy. Much louder than the Phillips/Norelco models, which you can barely hear. It's loud enough that if my wife is watching TV in the master bedroom, she has to bump the volume a little when I start shaving in the master bath. That is, unless I close the door. It would also wake her if I were to use it with the door open. The noise alone almost caused me to return it. The only reason I didn't is because the noise didn't disrupt anything for me. If I normally wanted to carry on a conversation with my wife in the mornings while getting ready for work...or if I often shaved while she was asleep, this would be a no-go. However, bear in mind that my wife and I have pretty sensitive ears. Also, our shower is tile and glass, so it's like an echo chamber in there. I'm sure that makes the sound more annoying.<br /><br />All that said, I still think it's the best you can get in the price range. Mine may have malfunctioned due to being used daily in the shower and being taken on several trips. I'm just tired of the noise by now, so I was thinking about replacing it anyway...so, since it's acting up on me, I'm going to go ahead and replace it with an upper-end Phillips/Norelco wet/dry model. I know it will be quieter and with the higher-end blade setup, it might also be a faster, closer shave than the cheaper models. We'll see...ur shower is tile and glass, so it's like an echo chamber in there. I'm sure that makes the sound more annoying.<br /><br />All that said, I still think it's the best you can get in the price range. Mine may have malfunctioned due to being used daily in the shower and being taken on several trips. I'm just tired of the noise by now, so I was thinking about replacing it anyway...so, since it's acting up on me, I'm going to go ahead and replace it with an upper-end Phillips/Norelco wet/dry model. I know it will be quieter and with the higher-end blade setup, it might also be a faster, closer shave than the cheaper models. We'll see...

  84. Hey, this really is a great shaver. I have been using razors for 35 yrs. (since I was 14). And I really liked the closeness of the Gillette Pro-Glide that I had been using. I like a very close shave and have tried electric shavers from time to time but I have never been satisfied with the results. I also like a comfortable shave and electric shavers that I have used in the past always made me feel like I was sticking my face in a blender or at best rubbing my cheeks against an electric sander...no thanks. Well I guess I am changing to become more like my dad...razors are getting ridiculously overpriced and I have come to the conclusion that I would rather stick my face in a blender or rub my cheeks up against an electric sander than have to pay $18-$20 every month for razors. So I started reading all these reviews and comparing all my possibilities and options. I was searching for a shaver that would be quick and easy to use and care for, and also a shaver that could give me a close and comfortable shave. I had pretty much resigned myself to the fact that the words \\"close\\" and \\"comfortable\\" would never fit into the same sentence with electric shaver. So I was prepared to go to work each day with razor burns and patches of 5-o'clock shadow somewhere on my beautiful mug...oh well secretaries would just have to get used to the new me! Boy was I surprised! I love this shaver! It is very quick -- it even lets you know how long it takes you to shave. This is a neat feature for guys like me who are always trying to beat their best time...first shave took about 6 minutes, now I am down to 2 and 1/2 minutes. The only reason it takes me that long is because I like to \\"message\\" my face for a while each morning -- feels great! Also it shaves very close...my face feels smoother than silicone on a baby's bottom. My wife is also impressed (trust me..that's saying alot), she calls me her gorilla-man, I usually have a 5-o'clock shadow by noon. So for this shaverto do all this is amazing...at least it works for me! Sorry for such a long review, but hopefully this will help someone trying to decide.
  85. I have been using Gillette Fusions and double edge razors (with Feathers blades)for over 30 years. I was tired of rush shaving in the mornings as I shower and constantly nicking myself. The shave is very, very close and super smooth even in clefts that I was always hesitant to attempt with the fusion razor. It is absolutely remarkable. I just wish I had bought it sooner. It is very easy to clean using only ordinary soft soap and tap water; it charges very quickly, shaves absolutely great in the shower, and is very nicely put together. I really was not disappointed,, gave me the closest shave I've had in years.
  95. I gave up on electric shavers about 6 years ago after buying the top of the line Braun and being incredibly disappointed. I have been using Mach 3 blades ever since and have been mostly happy. I recently began to realize that these razors are costing me a lot of money so I decided to try my luck with electric shavers again. I got this Panasonic and was blown away at how close the shave is!!! I didn't even have to get used to it, I got an incredibly close shave on the first day. I will recommend this thing to everyone I see. I love it. (ES8243A purchased on amazon sale for $79.99).

Those few times that I've previously used an electric razor had a bad irritation on my cheeks. Everyone says theres a 30 day period for your skin to get used to the razor. I have a sensitive skin, but from the 2nd time i've used it i had no razor burn, but have to admit you can't get a close shave no matter how much you try.

  99. (Update 12/28/2016) I have been using this razor since 2011 and it's still going strong. I just replace the blade and outer foil at regular times and it is ready to go again. Below I posted the link to the outer foil and blade. The battery is holding up very well and I still have consistent power through the whole charge. This was a great purchase! [[ASIN:B001J6O0IM Panasonic WES9161CL Men's Electric Razor Replacement Outer Foil]] [[ASIN:B001159UMM Panasonic WES9068PC Electric Razor Replacement Inner Blade for men]] Original Review (2011) I had been using a Braun since I started shaving. I logged on to Amazon and to look for a new blade and screen for my Braun... like I normally do. As I was looking I noticed the Panasonic razor and was drawn in by the great reviews. After some reading and careful thought I decided to take a chance. Switching after nearly twenty years of using a Braun... weird because I wasn't really unhappy with my Braun. But I did switch and I must say that I'm very happy I did! A few things I love about it: * I feel I'm getting a much better shave in less time. * It's comfortable to hold. * It seems to be able to supply steady constant power through the whole charge (It doesn't start to slow down as the battery drains). * I can rinse it in water or shave in the shower. Over all, this is a fantastic razor and the way I feel now, Panasonic will be my razor of choice for the next twenty years!
  100. I really enjoy shaving with this shaver every morning. It gives me a nice close comfortable shave in no time. Clean up is quick and easy. I am so glad I purchased this one espcially when I got it on a lighting deal sale.
  101. I received this shaver as a Christmas gift. I had been using a Gillette Fusion 5 and their gel, and one day got completely fed up with cutting myself no matter how careful I thought I was, so I was looking forward to a change. The first day did not go very well. I liked the idea of a wet shave with an electric razor, so I wet my face, used the Gillette gel and off I went. Bad idea. I cut myself in 3 spots, and had nasty razor burn on my neck. I wasn't going to give up that easily, so I let everything heal and tried it again, this time with some Lab Series pre-shave. Much, much better! It turns out I was pushing too hard, which they say in the instructions will not make for a closer shave. So, I knew I was on to something. I was running out of the Lab Series, which I bought when I was using a Norelco Arcitec from a few years back, but I needed a new prep. I stumbled on to a store brand of Afta pre-shave, and the difference was huge. I now get a far, far superior shave than I ever got from any blade razor, and my skin is much smoother and softer when I'm done shaving. I never got anything close to this with a rotary, and even my best days with the blade weren't this good. Reviews like this are tough, as I think everyone's face is going to be somewhat different, but this is by far the best electric shaver I've ever used, and at about $119 you can't beat it.

  103. This is my third Panasonic wet/dry shaver. My first wanted lasted me eight years I gave it to my best friend, he replaced the blades and it still works great. My second only lasted 2 years and quit working on me, it was a bad choice it did not give me the same shave as the first one. I almost decided to go to another brand but I gave Panasonic one more chance and I am very happy I did. This Panasonic gives me the best shave hands down, other than a razor. Works great wet or dry and I like the fact that it lets you know how much juice you got left. Charges quickly and I shaved my head with it the other day and it worked great (but nothing beats a razor on your head). One of the reviews said that the head was to big, it is bigger than the other Panasonics I have owned, but it does not interfere with the shave it actually gives a closer shave. Great product, I would recommend especially if you have a tough beard like mine. Thumbs up to Amazon & Panasonic.
  104. This is my first Panasonic razor. I have to admit, I was a little skeptical at first. I've been going back and forth between Braun, Remington, and Norelco for the last decade, but I heard good things about this razor and my Braun series 7 finally died. My experience with electric razors is that I can use them for a day or two, then they irritate my skin and I have to give them a rest for a day or two. I especially have trouble areas around my neck, and can never quite get all of the hairs there without getting a serious case of razor burn. I've been using the Panasonic for a couple of days now and my skin loves it. I don't have any issues shaving around my neck, and I don't even require aftershave when I'm done. I think the biggest difference is that you don't have to apply pressure for this razor to do its thing. Just touch it to your skin, move it around a little, and let the razor do the work. I've been shaving dry and have the best shave I've ever had from any electric or blade. Like many other reviews stated, don't bother with the cleaning version of this razor. I just got the stand alone razor and have been cleaning it with liquid soap and water. I'll never go back to self-cleaning razors after my Braun decided to pump cleaning solution all over my granite counter top while I was away at work. That was fun to come home to!
  105. I have owned it for over a year now. I used to be on Norelco and then switched to this one. Norelco never gave me this close a shave. This one gives me as close a shave as a blade - even after one year. I can't add anymore to the positive things mentioned by the other reviewers. Close shave, ease of cleaning, wet-dry, etc are all very positive. Couple of minor gripes - but not big enough to reduce the rating. 1. You can't use it while plugged in. So if you are out of battery charge you have to wait until it charges. At least once a month I run out of charge in the middle of the shave and then have to wait 10 minutes to get enough charge to finish my shave. 2. It is rather noise when close to the ear. But I would buy this again.
  106. Fits the hand perfectly. It is light, easy to move over your every facial contour and shave closer than a blade.

I finally decided to spend a little more on a quality razor, but I should have looked deeper into the reviews before taking them at face value. Like the five-star rater said above, it does a horrible job on the neck, and doesn't shave that closely at all. Maybe the wet/dry feature is nice, but that seems irrelevant if it's a bad shave. It's not great, but razors with the 3 spinning heads, like Norelco, do better with harder to reach places and curve better to the neck.

  112. Great shaver: holds power a good week; easy clean with the turbo overdrive option (don't waste your money on the \\"auto clean\\" models-they are expensive, require monthly refills of the cleaning solution and aren't any more effective than this turbo model); high speed for faster shaving; quick recharge; a fantastic lighted display panel that tells you when the charge is down to 10%. BUT...the little tiny holes in the mesh screens are too small for some of the tree stumps growing out my face. Maybe in Japan, where this is made, they have fine beards, but I don't. Make the dang holes in the mesh bigger. I have to go over the missed hairs with a disposable razor. I bought this thing to AVOID disposable nick and cut razors in the first place!

  116. Using it more than a year and still like it.
  117. Use this shaver to shave my head. My skin is sensitive so shaving with a razor is out of the question. I was using normal clippers for a long time but that can only get so close. Eventually I switched to a rotary shaver which worked fine but did tend to irritate my skin in some more sensitive spots (like the neck). Problem with the rotary shaver is that it tended to gunk up fairly easily and was more difficult to clean. It also had a tendency to pull hairs. With the Panasonic I am able to use some Neutrogina Shave Cream for sensitive skin and since it is a wet/dry shaver I take in the shower and zero irritation. It charges fast and comes apart easily for cleaning, haven't had any issues with it gunking up. The head of the shaver had the ability to either be in flexible mode or with a simple switch you can lock it to be rigid, this probably would come in handy for shaving one's face. All in all, I am extremely satisfied.
  118. I bought this Panasonic model for traveling, and it hasn't disappointed me. It's compact, lightweight, and the wet/dry capability makes it easy to clean under the tap. It gives a nice, comfortable shave, although not quite with one pass as claimed. For this reason I use a top model Braun shaver at home, which does shave more closely but is charged and cleaned in a cradle that is too bulky for traveling. In short, as a travel shaver, I give this model a high rating!

  123. i like to shave with a wet face, so based on the good reviews this shaver had received i went ahead and bought it. Frankly, i did not expect such a close shave. The shave is comfortable, fast and very close even in the areas like the chin and neck where tradititionally i could not get a very close shave. In the past I was using a norelco coolskin for years and i was quite happy with it, very durable, fairly close shave although not very close around the neck and chin. Then i bought an arcitec which i regretted since the shave was very poor and the shaver very expensive. I have had the 8243 for two weeks now and i am really surpised at how close the shave is. It is a great product, excellent price and the battery is good as i have used it 10 times now it still has 30% to go. The only disadvantage is the noise, it is certainly louder than my previous two electric shavers but not enough to give it anything less than 5 stars rating.
  124. I've been using Panasonic wet/dry shavers for 25 years and have been an electric shaver user all my life. I have the usual sensitive skin/tough beard shared my many other electric shaver users. I shave wet, with Edge Sensitive Skin gel. I've used many other kinds of shavers, including Remington and Norelco, most recently the Norelco with the skin lubricant dispenser built in. I've tried the 3-, 4-, and 5-blade razors as they've been introduced, just to see if my skin could take it. It couldn't. The ES8243A is by far the best shave I've gotten. I'd been using the Panasonic ES8018 for years and it was due for replacement--batteries not holding a charge, needed new heads, trimmer not working well. I resisted the newer shavers because I didn't like the idea of the swiveling, spring-suspended head. I felt that I knew my own face best and didn't want the head wobbling this way and that. I quickly discovered that I was wrong. The four cutting heads are individually sprung and the head's suspension springs are calibrated to give exactly the right pressure for a close, comfortable shave. This shaver is a huge technological advance over the last one. I've always hated shaving. Now it's actually an enjoyable experience. I also used to laugh at Panasonic's notion of a three minute shave being typical. It usually took me twice as long, often longer, to knock down my heavy beard, then go after the strays. The ES8243A shave is consistently three minutes and it's far superior to anything I've had before. One final word about electric shaving: Ears. I get some thick, dark hairs on my lobes and more on the tragus, that little bump in front of the canal. An electric shave is the only way to trim these closely, and this shaver is the most comfortable yet--it doesn't bite and draw blood, as some of my earlier shavers did. When she was a preteen, my daughter once teased me, \\"Ha ha, Daddy shaves his ears!\\" I replied, \\"How would you like it if I didn't?\\" She conjured up animage in her mind, looked horrified, and said no more about it.
  125. I have been using this razor for about a month now. Replaced an earlier Panasonic razor I owned for about three years (battery failed!). Very quiet, cuts well and charges quickly. The shaving head is wider than my previous version, so it dosen't get into the \\"tighter\\" areas my old one did. Never tried shaving wet yet. Still recommend this razor because it does the job quick and well. A quick update. 12/12/09. Do NOT buy this razor!! Just stopped working. I am so sick and tired of buying these expensive electric razors only to have them break down WAY too early. Don't waste your money. Buy a decent cheap razor and get your monies worth. Thanks alot panasonic!!

I opted for this model [[ASIN:B001DKMY9Q Panasonic ES8243A Arc IV Nano Men's Wet/Dry Rechargeable Shaver, Blue]] instead of the one with the cleaning station [[ASIN:B0021AG0Z6 Panasonic ES8249S Arc IV Nanotech Vortex Wet/Dry Rechargeable Shaver, Silver]] because I didn't want the clutter. But I wondered if I'd miss the cleanliness; so I was pleased to see that even without the extra cleaning base, these shavers have a hypersonic cleaning mode that you perform manually with soap and water - and the LED display has a reminder when to do it -- it keeps track of when it needs to be cleaned. Great! 10 years ago, both my linear Panasonic shavers' batteries died much sooner than expected, so I abandoned the Panasonic brand for a while even though the shave was superior. Now I'm back; I hope the battery lasts. The shave quality is definitely worth coming home to and worth another try on battery life. Btw, Panasonic must have the best shaver design division on the planet -- all their hair removal products, from epilator [[ASIN:B000K0QWMU Panasonic Wet/Dry Epiglide 3-in-1 Epilator Hair Removal System with Skin Protector]] to groomer [[ASIN:B000F4USF8 Panasonic ER224S All-in-One Cordless Hair and Beard Trimmer (Silver)]], are superior to the competition, and I've spent $100's trying all the major brands -- after years of painful hair abatement by trial and error, I finally settled on using a combination of these Panasonic products on different body regions. When I find something that really works, it just happens to be a Panasonic.

The only minor issue I noted was that the on/off button is right where my fingers would rest when I held the shaver. Sometimes I would hit the on/off button-turning the razor off. I've now changed the way I hold the shaver so that my fingers aren't over the button---even old dogs can learn to do things differently.....

  144. I've had about 10 different electric razors over the years. Some good, some terrible, some Ok. This one has been my favorite so far. Most of the others I've had were either Braun or Norelco because that's what they have at the big, buy everything stores. I like just about everything about the Panasonic. It has four razors that cut well. The head is able to move slightly to adjust to my face. I can use it wet, dry or even with shaving cream/lotion. It has a nice display that shows the battery life and when it's time for a cleaning. The coolest thing for me is probably the cleaning. You just put some regular hand soap in the head, turn it on and let it foam, then rinse it out. And it really does clean it well. As with all razors, I'm still learning how best to use it, but so far, I'm really satisfied with the closeness and quality of shave with this razor.

  148. I've used this shaver every morning since 5/24/10. Shaving dry with it is OK, but wet is best. You can use it with shaving cream, soapy lather, or just warm water. Whichever, I suggest dousing your face with a washrag and warm water several times to soften the whiskers before shaving. Move the shaver briskly over your face and in 4-5 minutes you should be rewarded with the closest shave you've ever had with an electric razor. I get 8 or 9 shaves to a charge.The only thing about this Panasonic that I find inconvenient is that when the shaver is used wet, it (the foil head especially) will collect gunk and requires cleaning fairly often. This is the tradeoff for the close shave. The Norelcos I used for 30+ years (dry) never gave a shave like the Panasonic but were a snap to clean (just blow out the head).<br />Update May 2012: after two years using this shaver I'm still getting the closest shave ever from an electric razor; however, I'd describe it as a close but harsh shave that has caused problems with acne that I never had even as a teenager. I've abandoned the Panasonic in favor of a Norelco Aquatec 810.
  149. I break out with adult acne every once in a while and shaving with a razor can irritate the acne prone areas. My dermatologist recommended a hybrid approach, where I would shave with an electric razor on my neck and regular blade shaving on the rest of my beard. Well, I just got this electric razor and it works great. I did not get the irritation that I normally get when shaving with a standard blade. The manual mentions that there is a 30 day period till the skin gets used to this way of shaving. If my first couple of shaves have been good, I can only imagine this getting better. Do not expect, the same level of closeness that you would get with standard shaving, but it comes pretty close to it.

It is the most I have ever paid for a shaver, but well worth it if your looking for a close shave and doesn't leave your skin irritated.
  151. So, I've never been one to get an extremely good shave, although the 5 blade jobs have come pretty close (pun intended). I switched (back) to electric after my dermatologist told me to in order to alleviate some skin problems. I've had many electrics, including older rotary and a recent straight foil shaver. None of them did a particularly good job, and nowhere near as good as the Mach razors. Well, this Panasonic completely changed my expectations. On day one I got a very nice shave, and a week later it seems to be holding and/or maybe getting better. Everyone says you should give it a few weeks for your hair to \\"adjust\\", so we'll see what happens. The instructions suggest you should wet shave with soap/lather, but for me it works much better dry before the shower. The only downside is my showers are sometimes hot enough that it seems like I can make more hair show up during the shower :) (From the water softening your skin and relaxing the beard hair...) So, I may switch to post-shower shaves. I also use it to shave my head. It's a bit more awkward than a blade, so I may not switch over completely; it's just hard to do the \\"multipass\\" that you have to do with electrics when holding the razor behind your head ;-) You can tell from the sound how much faster the motor is than other razors, which may indicate why this one works so much better (more oscillations = more times the blades cross the face). At any rate, for a razor in the $100 range (and Amazon continually has coupons/sales that lower it $30 or so), it's an excellent buy. I'm still not sure it will ever be as close as a blade, but it definitely provides a decent shave with less skin irritation/breakouts.
  152. I bought this shaver for my husband who wanted to be able to shave in the shower and on the go. He has enjoyed its use for three months now. He still prefers the razor shave because he feels that this razor leaves stubble marks. Cons: It's quite sharp so he still gets cut with it like he does with a razor. He has very sensitive skin. Pros: Easy to transport. Removes all the soft whiskers. Versatile. It holds its charge well. Signals when the charge is low. Fairly close shave.
  153. I decided to get this model instead of the ES8103S solely on the fact that it had 4 blades instead of 3. When opened you see 2 inner blades attached to the main unit, and 2 blades attached to the foil. I was expecting 4 inner blades, but I am pleased to say this unit is as advertised and is the BEST electric razor I have owned in my 20 plus years of owning one. This is my3rd or 4th Panasonic and they have all been the wet/dry types, the last one being the Smooth Operator ES718, which was not my favorite. It did not take long to charge this unit, probably about an hour as advertised on the box. I do not think it's too loud at all as some reviewers have said. It sounds nicer than the old ES718, more like happy bees buzzing rather than irritated wasps! At 42 I still have sensitive skin, and I prefer going every other day between shaves, particularly with a Mach 4 and cream. But now I don't mind using this unit every day and I look forward to it! I seem to average just over 4 minutes per shave and the feeling is very smooth. I don't feel it tugging at my skin or hurting it in any way. The head pivots very nicely and it stays on my skin with no problem. I am very impressed with the lack of irritation and the closeness of the shave, the closest I have ever gotten from an electric. I rarely use wet/dry units with cream, but I did try it in the shower once and it worked well, if you use some soap for lubricant. Minor issues: The head is big, and the only thing that the ES718 seemed to be better at was shaving the mustache area. This unit takes a bit of maneuvering to get that area clean, but overall, not that bad. My first charge lasted 2 weeks, and there is a battery indicator, which you should look at closely. I didn't and expected the unit to sound like it was slowing down before it cut out. Not at all. It sounds like it's fully charged and will die on you in under 10 seconds, and you cannot connect it to the wall outlet and use at the same time. I would have loved to see this razor at a store to look at, but for whatever reason I can't find many Panasonics around, other than their lower priced ones, and only at Best Buy. But I took a chance and got this at a great price at Amazon, and it was delivered only 2 days after ordering, and at the standard free shipping rate. WOW! I've had it for less than a month and I love it. It's very attractive with its blue and silver colors. It is very easy to clean. I get a much better shave with foil compared to a rotary. I was given a Remington PowerClean Titanium R-1000 a couple years ago, and I just didn't care for it's performance at all and it irritated me no matter how long I used it. I am very happy I purchased the Panasonic ES8243A and I will be getting many good years out of this razor. I highly recommend it.
  154. i bought many top of the line shavers arcetic - braun - then finally panasonic best shaver i ever bought and also cheap price
  155. This shaver does a very good job. Much nicer shave than my previous Remington. Earlier Panasonics are not comparable. Shaves very close and comfortable. Fairly quick. Cleaning is easy and the unit seems tough enough to last awhile. I suspect the higher cost shaver that includes the cleaning stand is not necessary. This one cleans simple and does not require a special solution. Blade and screen replacements are somewhat expensive, but worth it if they keep it shaving at current level. I would buy it again.<br /><br />Hi. I decided to add a 2nd review a couple years later when it counts. I purchased another of the same razor. The first razor still runs well but the charging system won't connect all the time. The electric connection pins are corroded on the charging unit. I believe from me leaving the razor on the charger all the time, and charging when wet. I just blow the pins off before plugging in and only charge as needed now and have seen no difficulty on the new razor. I tried one of the cheaper 2 blade Panasonics and was disappointed. It didn't compare. Also, when the razor gets noisy or pulls hair you have gone past the time to change blades. Don't push too hard and it cuts great.
  156. Please note: I should probably finish evaluating these things before posting reviews since I changed this review in favor of the ES8101S before I figured out I was using too much pressure with the ES8243A and that was why I was getting irritation. So my recommendation is that the ES8243A is better if you don't press really hard into your neck/face like I was doing. My old review that is true if you don't use too much pressure: Let me start by saying I have sensitive skin and tough neck hairs which really seem grow in different directions, and I have always nicked/scratched my neck up when using a manual razor, especially around my reasonably protrusive Adam's apple. Six months ago I jumped on a deal for the Panasonic ES8101S (like the ES8109S minus the expensive cleaning station), and I have been pretty pleased with what it had to offer since it can be used both for wet-shaving and dry. I just found that regular dry-shaving with it would not provide enough skin protection, and wet-shaving would give me trouble around my aforementioned Adam's apple since wet-shaving does get closer than any dry-shaving shaver. Then THE deal ($80) for this ES8243A came along and I had to see if it could beat an already pretty versatile and powerful Panasonic shaver. Again I tried wet-shaving (shower, wash face, hot/wet towel, good shaving cream), and this shaver totally rocks for that, since it drastically reduces the time needed to shave and gets closer than any dry method. I just find that with my sensitive skin paired with shaving everyday, the closest possible shave may not be right for me. Enter Afta Pre-Electric Original-scented, which I find to be more pleasant and mild than the Fresh-scented variety. Conventional wisdom is to dry shave (with Afta) before showering and washing your face, but I find that the hairs do not stand up well and you end up needing to go over and over the same areas to get good results. So I tried this shaver with Afta AFTER my shower, and I willnever look back! The hairs really stand up and, with my skin pulled taut, the shaver really plows right through them; it gets as close as I need without irritation on the area around my neck. Shave time is definitely less than with my previous Panasonic due to the extra middle \\"blade\\" and better design (flatter shaving surface), so this really is the best Panasonic shaver yet. It comes with a built-in timer and traveling case, which aren't critical but are certainly appreciated, and it doesn't come with an expensive cleaning station which is actually a feature IMHO. Cleaning stations aren't really necessary with wet/dry shavers since cleaning can be accomplished just by running them under water in turbo-mode with the occasional use of liquid soap and then wiping them dry. The only negative for some travelers may be the battery life since a full charge might last for only 5-6 shaves depending on how long each shave takes for you (mine take 6-7 minutes each). Thus, I would definitely recommend this shaver for even sensitive skin types over anything else on the market so far - wet or dry - when used after a shower and with the right skin conditioner. Pros: Made in Japan (vs. China like my ES8101S), top of the line Panasonic with \\"4\\" blades, wet/dry versatility, closest shave for any electric without irritation (I've used the Norelco Advantage also but that irritated my neck), easy to clean (without needing a cleaning station), blades/foil last a long time, timer/battery life indicator, traveling case, trimmer, nice blue color Cons: Battery life could be better

  160. If I was to think of a modern miracle, I would think of two of them, Google being the first one and the Panasonic ES 8243 A the second one. Since the subject matter for this review is the electric shaver, let's get started with the discussion. This shaver is a 4-bladed system with Nano technology, rechargeable, and it has a very sweet 13,000cpm motor to drive it's moving parts..............and they do drive very well, thank you. The unit comes with a very nice liquid crystal display telling you the remaining time of use, when to clean the blades, and how fast it charges and the status of the charge. A special electric cord comes with the unit for charging purposes, or if you want to use it without using the battery - just `wall power'! One of its best features is that it can be used wet or dry and can be washed with running water. What does shaving wet do for you? It provides for a lubricant (a water-shampoo mix) and the shaver will glide along the surface of your skin and be kinder to your handsome face! Let me explain how I use it, step- by- step and end up with THE BEST shave ever, without cuts, sensitive skin, cut hair caught between the blades, or blades that have to be replaced about once a week. Before shaving your face will start out feeling like sandpaper, course-grit, and end up smooth as a baby's skin! First, wash your face with warm water and soap. Leave it wet, and rub on a little shampoo where you plan to shave. Be sure you face is wet! Use the shaver up and down, side to side, and at angles to perpendicular and parallel lines. Rinse your face and feel for areas that you either missed or have not shaven closes enough. Apply more shampoo to your wet face and shave again. Finish with a warm water rinse to the face, dry it, and apply a moisturizer cream or sun-block. The shaving time, for me, is about 4.5 minutes. Take the shaver and apply a little liquid soap or shampoo to the top of the razor as it runs and let it clean itself for 15-20seconds. Take off the foil part of the shaver and blow off excess moisture around the blades. Dry the outside of the shaver and let the components dry on a folded cloth towel and away from your kids or pets. At your next shave, put the shaver together and have fun using it again. You will be amazed at the quality, construction, and shave that you'll get from the Panasonic ES 8243 A. Don't pay extra for a cleaner for the unit and shave yourself a few bucks. This shaver rates 5-Stars +++! Paul Beck P.S. I saved money, postage and time buying it from Amazon.com
  161. I've been blade shaving since I started shaving (68 yrs old). I've tried several electrics but I was not satisifed with any of them so when the wet/dry shavers came along I thought I'd give this one a try. I purchased it in December '09 and I wanted to use it a while so I waited until to write this review so I could give it a fair rating. I will have to say that I was impressed from the start, but I do have some recomendations though. When wet shaving reduce your lather by 3/4 and keep your lather wet and thin. A lot of thick lather seems to clog up the head somewhat. I also have tried shaving using just warm water but using just a little lather seems to work a lot better. I sometimes dry shave whenever I just want a quick touch-up and I believe that using a pre-shave lotion such as Williams Lectric Shave works well this way. About 6 months or so after purchasing the razer all the read-outs started staying lit when the shaver was in use. This didn't bother me to much and didn't seem to affect the performance of the razer but I contacted Panasonic anyway just to make them aware of the problem. Their response was NONE. I sent them another e-mail a couple of weeks ago and still no response. So I would say that this is a 5-star razer and comes with 0-star customer service. Bottom line is this shaver will give you good close shaves, not as close as a blade but by the same token it does not remove as much skin as a blade does either.
