  377. I've been using electric shavers all of my adult life (30+ years) but have never gotten such a close shave (even on rare occasions when I had to use a blade). With a little shaving gel, this baby did in less than four minutes what no other electric shaver has ever done--remove all traces of stubble and left me with my cheeks and chin smooth as a baby's backside. After a little cheek-to-cheek test (which I recommend be done *every* morning, by the way), my wife gave it a thumbs-up, too! Hopefully I won't be looking like Fred Flintstone by 5 PM anymore.
  378. This is a very nice shaver. I have been very unimpressed with electric shavers up until now. I am really impressed with the quality of the shave this provides. It is by far the best electric shaver I have ever used, and I have used quite a few over the years. It is really nice to be able to use it wet, or in the shower. It gives a much closer shave without any irritation when used with face soap or shaving cream. In the past I used mostly rotary shavers. This was my first higher end foil type shaver and I will not go back to the rotary variety ever again. So far, It has proven to have great battery life. I have only had to charge it after 5-7 days of shaving. My wife was also very impressed with the closeness of the shave. The rotaries I have used in the past came nowhere near the smooth, close shave that this one achieves. I will certainly buy another one if/when this one wears out. I am one of the people that researches things to excess before I buy. This was well reviewed on multiple sites and I am glad I took the time to thoroughly research these these types of shavers before I plunked down the $100+ for this model. So far it has proven itself worth every penny. If you are on the fence, I suggest you give it a shot. You won't be disappointed. Donovan
  379. I've had several brands of shavers, including previous Panasonic models. I'd read the ads, etc. on the 7-series Braun and gave it a try. In the long run, I was not impressed. The battery life was poor and it didn't cover all areas of my face well. This Panasonic is the best one yet. The battery lasts for several shaves. The unit is comfortable to hold. And most importantly, it gives a nice close shave in less time than the Braun. You can tell the biggest difference in the afternoon. The Panasonic shave was still fairly smooth even at 5pm, whereas the Braun shave felt like you needed to shave again if you are going out. I don't miss the cleaning system and purchasing the solution. A little soap & water every few days and it's clean. I won't venture away from Panasonic again.
  380. Excellent performance, wet and dry for a low price, very easy to clean, the shave is smooth and fast, ergonomic design making this shaver easy to manipulate. The battery durability is very good, I am recharging after a week and something, and I am shaving no just my face but my head as well. For me that one is a winner in comparison with other brands that I have had in the past and old Panasonic models. http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B001DKMY9Q/ref=cm_cr_rev_prod_title
  381. Note: This review is only commenting on using the razor as a wet razor.<br /><br />I have been using this razor for about 1 month and am very pleased with the close shave in the shower. My wife hated my old electic and wanted me to get something with a much closer shave. I tried using other electric razors including Norelco and Remington (both wet and dry) and I also tried blade razors (including Mach 3 & 5 blade Fusion). None of them gave me a better shave than this panasonic razor (including the blades) when I use it in the shower with shave gel. I have not gotten shave bumps or irritation which is something I experience with all of the blade razors I tried. I do have to go over the same areas a few times to get a very close shave, but anyone that has ever used an electric razor knows that is a given. The razor is also quite noisy, but again a common find with most razors. Also, the razor feels strudy and the charge lasts about 5-10 shaves, which is quite good in my experience.
  382. The reviews I read were favorable for this shaver so I decided to give it a try. (I have been using rotary shavers for many years and have always been happy with them.) Well, I really like the Panasonic shaver. It gives a very close shave especially using it wet will a shaving gel. Less irritation than the rotary and a quicker shave. My one concern is how long the blades will last before needing replacement. They are fairly expensive so hopefully a few years. Only time will tell.

  384. I have used top of the line Norelco shavers for 30+ years, but because of the reviews of others I tried this Panasonic. It blows the Norelco's away. This Panasonic shaver is comfortable and does a great job with just one pass, the top of the line Norelco needed many passes to get a shave that was not nearly as close.   391. I received this shaver as a Christmas gift. The foil developed a small hole after 4 months of normal use. I called Panasonic to find out that foils are not under warranty and a replacement foil would cost $60 and the cost of shipping. I believe the razor cost my brother $85 on sale. $60 for a foil, really???? I was told the normal life of the foil should be one year. I am sorry but if this foil failed after 4 months of use I believe that indicates a defect which should be covered under some type of warranty. Panasonic really needs to take a few courses in Business 101 and have definitely lost a customer. There out of pocket cost for this part is probably about $3. Considering the circumstances they should have just sent me a new foil. Repeat customers are more valuable to a company then a lost customer and a bad review (which will hopefully lose them a few more) than a lousy $3 foil that was apparently defective. By the way the shaver's performance is not what is hyped up to be anyway. Buy at you own risk!

  395. I have been buying Panasonic electric razors ever since they were first sold by Sharper Image. I purchased this model to replace a dying ES8249 that is about 5 years old. I get blades and foils every 6 months without having to think about it. This razor, and all my previous Panasonic's, give me a great shave.   396. I owned a Braun 7 series shaver from sometime around 2005 until early this year. It was an overall good shaver, but after such a long time, the battery was starting to get low and I decided to gift it to a friend and get back in the market to see if there was new technology out there. Like a lot of guys, I think, I'm always on the hunt for a shaver that can get the job done in the least amount of time possible. I'm also a redhead with sensitive skin that breaks out if I use a blade, so it's been shavers for years. After hunting around, I purchased this Panasonic in early 2010. So, I have about six months in on it. I don't have much of a beard, so I can get by with shaving every other day, for the most part. In comparison with the Braun, it does a better job at getting the bigger stuff on the first pass. I do notice that to get the really close shave, I sometimes have to angle it a little bit so that the foils, which are on the outside edges, can get more surface contact and take off that last little nub of hair coming out of the hair shaft. My only real disappointment with this shaver is battery life. Since I shave every other day, I can go about 10 days without recharging. This is on a brand-new battery (it's been this way since I bought it). For me, at least, the Braun was still going longer than this without a recharge after like 5 years of use. And when it was new, I easily went longer than two weeks. I found this to be unexpectedly disappointing. As far as wet/dry, I tried just wet (no shaving cream). I seem to get a better, quicker shave if I shave dry right before hopping in the shower. That may just be because that's what I've been doing for years and am more used to doing it that way. Would I buy it again? Maybe, but I would probably take a harder look at the Brauns again first.
  397. I purchased this product after being impressed by its positive reviews on Amazon. I must say I am extremely disappointed with this product. I gave myself sometime before I came to any conclusions. I also used it with the Pre-Shaving lotion as recommended by many. Although the results were better but only slightly. The manufacturer recommends you use the product for at least a month so that your skin adjusts to the shaver but I still do not find any significant improvement after using this for over 2 months. I have to run the shaver back and forth numerous times before I can get a decent shave. I must add that for the first time I feel the reviews at Amazon to be biased.   398. Update Dec 2012: Had this shaver for almost two years now....still works great. Replaced the screen and blades only once (after a year). I think rinsing after each use prolongs the blade vs using the brush tool (which I've never used). Nice razor...though I see it is about $21 more now than it was in Dec 2010. Still very happy with this product.<br /><br />I purchased the Panasonice shaver in Dec. 2010, just after Christmas. I decided to try it based on the positive reviews. Having used electric razors in the past, they never really performed all that well, but the reviews convinced me to give it a try again. I have used inexpensive disposable blade razors but they usually perform just OK and getting knicks was not uncommon...so I had to get the more expensive premium blades to get a close, clean, shave. So I decided to try the Panasonic ES8243A. I have been VERY pleased with this razor. It shaves about as close as the premium disposable blades and of course you don't need shaving cream. Once the razor is charged, you will be able to use it for a week on a single charge (you don't need to keep it plugged in...just charge and use for the week). It recharges fairly quickly as well (maybe an hour for a full charge). The instructions guide you to clean it with water after so many shaves (and the razor has an indicator symbol to tell you when to clean using the cleaning mode - an ultra-high vibration mode), but I rinse the blade and screen after almost every shave to keep it clean. I have also used the original blade now for almost 11 months....and it still cuts well! I don't use the cleaning brush that comes with the razor as rinsing it keeps it clean. Great razor.....I am impressed with how this razor performs. After 11 months it still cuts about as close as a blade.

  401. I'll start off with the admission that I normally use razor blades to shave (specifically Fusion ProGlide). I have tried electric shavers in the past but have always felt they caused more irritation and couldn't provide as close a shave as a razor blade. I first tried this shaver dry, and although my skin is very sensitive, I was able to get a good shave without much discomfort at all. The next day I tried the shaver on a wet shave, and it felt wonderful. It felt like a face massage in the shower, and alhough it took me some time to get a close shave, it was quite enjoyable. I have had a couple of small issues with the shaver, mostly when I use it after letting my stubble grow out for a couple days. I've managed to cut myself with the shaver on two occassions--both times were on my neck and while shaving 4-5 days of hair growth. I've also found it very difficult to get a clean shave with more than 2 days of growth. The good: comfortable shave, easy to use, wet/dry capability. The bad: doesn't work well on longer hair growth. Verdict: A good shaver for every day use. Do not use to cut significant hair growth.

  439. I used a Norelco Spectra razor for over 5 years before getting the Panasonic. The Norelco worked pretty well, but did not provide a really close shave, and I felt like it irritated my face. I use the Panasonic with shaving gel and hot water, and it definitely shaves closer--almost as close as a blade, although it misses a hair or two on my neck. My face feels better too. The trimmer works very well. Battery life could be a little bit better, but I really like the shave time/battery display. I recommend this razor, especially if you can get it for less than $100.
  440. I'll make this short and sweet, hoping I could possibly convey those with a similar situation to switch over to this electric razor. Firstly, I am 24 years old and cursed with thick,black facial hair and incredibly sensitive skin. Previously, I've been shaving with all sorts of straight blade razors...Mach 3...Fusion..disposable...Schick Quattro etc. etc. etc. While the shaves are close, the discomfort DURING the shave, and the pain AFTER the shave (from tons of nicks and cuts usually, no matter how hard I try). I usually would shave every OTHER day, and now my job requires I shave daily...its a nightmare. Sure, the pain goes away and so does the bleeding after a quick shower and an hour, but jeez who wants to go through that every morning? I tried expensive shaving creams, gels, oils, RAZORS....nothing. All temporary fixes. NOW. I used to have a top of the line braun about 3 years ago. It was a pretty good shave but got my skin all hot and bothered, soon I stopped using it. Lets talk about the ARC 4. TWO SHAVES IN, it is immediatly the smoothest, most comfortable, CLOSEST shave I've ever had in my freaking life. YES, closer than a blade! I SWEAR TO YOU, GOD MADE THIS RAZOR FOR MEN. With a bit of shaving cream, the experience is sublime. No irritation, no cuts, no nothing. I can only imagine how good this thing will get in a few weeks as I adjust to it and it to me. So far I am so impressed that it can hardly get closer or more comfortable. Hear me say this one more time - THIS SHAVER GETS CLOSER THAN A MACH 3 ON MY SECOND DAY USING IT. IN 3 MINUTES. WITHOUT A STEAM SHOWER. For $130 this is the best thing I've ever bought and I urge more men with a similar situation to get on it immediatly! It fits comfortably in your hand, doesn't make a ton of noise (others think its loud? really??), and washes clean without an expensive base to take up your vanity space. God did indeed make this razor, and he gave it to Panasonic to distribute. Thank GOD!
  441. This razor lives up to the hype. I shave in 60% less time (approx 4 mins)and ths shave is as close as a blade. It's easy to clean and use. It's hard for me to believe that I will ever use another brand.
  442. Part of the system outer foil has disintegrated to where I can't use it. Shaver was brought Dec 2, 2011. Always performed cleaning according to the owners manual. This is totally ridiculous! The system outer foil costs $60.00 plus shipping. The shaver only cost me $106.60 from Amazon. Shaver work good on a two to three day growth but using it everyday really irritated my face. Would not recommend any Panasonic product due to the useless warranty.

  444. This thing is just great, I have been persevering with a Braun I paid $59 for at Walmart, and this is like nite and day, no pressure, no going over and over your chin trying to get a close shave, it just cuts so close with no pulling. I'm sold, I'll never use anything else but a Panasonic ever again and this has got four blades too.   445. Purchased about a month ago and have been using it daily for about four weeks. I have used every brand of electric razor under the sun. This one is nice because it isn't too loud and is very easy to clean. The charge is fast and lasts for over a week before needing to be recharged. The readout display is simple and easy to use at a glance. I especially like the fact that it can be used wet or dry. On the downside it takes longer than most shavers to get a true close shave. Several passes though and it achieves a nice smooth shave. This shaver does not do too well on the neck area. My neck has been irritated consistently since using the razor, I'm hoping this will cease as I use the razor more. I have relatively thick growth, I have a true five o clock shadow by dinner time so most razors have to work hard on my face. I would say it is probably worth the money if you find a great deal on Amazon.
  446. Love this shaver. Only complaint is you can't use it while it's recharging. Whats up with that.
  447. I have this posted as well on Amazon.ca from a Canadian's perspective, but I'll re-post it here with some revisions because my experience addresses some of the (few) negatives about this fantastic shaver. Let me start by stating that for the first time in my life, I actually enjoy shaving! Prior to buying this product over 2 months ago, I had been using the Gillette Mach 3 series of disposable blades for almost 10 years. In recent months, I was considering going back to an electric shaver, but I wasn't motivated enough to make the switch. However, I came into a job situation that required me to be clean-shaven every day, but the blades were leaving my face raw and often bloody on the neck so the absolute most I could handle was shaving once every two days. This didn't matter whether the blades were new or old, or whether I used cream or gel. So I did what I normally do: went onto Amazon.com (or .ca) and researched. I zeroed-in on the Braun Series 7 shavers because I had used Philips rotary shavers prior to 10 years ago and wasn't impressed with the quality of shave, plus the rotary blades were a time-waster to pull apart and clean. I'm sure technology has improved since then, but I decided that my next one would be a foil shaver regardless. However, the Braun Series 7 shavers had a rather mixed set of reviews regarding quality and customer service, different reviewers stating how this might be the result of no longer being exclusively built in Germany and also because Braun in North America has been bought out. So I was on the hunt again. The Panasonic ES8243A caught my eye next because it is rated very highly on this site with very few negative reviews relative to positive ones, so I decided to take my chance even though I have always associated Panasonic with video players and microwave ovens! Right when you open the box, there's a piece of paper that encourages you to shave for 30 days with this product before deciding it's not for you - a verywise move on the part of Panasonic. I also noticed some wonderful words that you don't often see too much any more: \\"Made in Japan\\". This alone was music to my eyes. My first few shaves were a learning curve, to be sure, like any new product. I also started with wet shaves - using products like Cremo Cream and water, or just plain water - because I feared the same burning sensation as my old Philishave. However, getting tired of the same routine and mess as using blades, I decided to try dry shaving and find this to be my preference by far. My face does not get irritated, unless I try to go at it for too long; I have to remind myself that no electric shaver will get as close as a blade, although I must say that this Panasonic comes darn close, perhaps as close as any electric shaver will get. The first few times I shaved with it, some portions of my neck under the jawbone were causing me grief; there were always some stray hairs, much to my frustration. But now, especially with a dry shave, this is not the case. So the key with this shaver is PATIENCE. Don't even THINK of returning it or complaining until you've given it a couple dozen chances. The odds are extremely high that if you do, you'll consider this the best electric shaver that you've ever used. Cleaning this shaver is ridiculously simple, probably because the head design is ridiculously simple: Just remove the foil, rinse the cutting blades under the tap, and use some liquid soap if necessary. However, I have not once needed to use the soap. Then I just let it sit out to dry before I re-assemble it and put it away. Sometimes I don't even rinse it; I'll just shake/brush out the clippings and put it away when I'm in a hurry. I know that I could have chosen a cheaper shaver, but why? I know that there would be some sort of compromise in the closeness and comfort of the shave. Besides that, this shaver doesn't come with a cleaning station that requires expensive cleaning solution, so I'm onlyspending money long-term on foil and cutting blade replacements, and no more either on disposable blades and shaving gel. I can get a great shave in under 4 minutes if I've shaved the day before. (The fact that I can shave every day is something I could have never dreamed of with a blade, or even with my Philishave of old. This alone gives this shaver a top rating in my mind.) If I have 2-3 days worth of growth, it will take a little over 5 minutes, but this is way better than the 7-8 minutes when I first started out and trying to get used to its operation or the up to 10 minutes with a blade and shaving gel (including prep and clean-up time). If there is one strike against this shaver, it's the fact that you can't operate it while it's plugged in and charging. Sometimes this would be nice when the indicator is showing only 10-20% battery power left! And because a full charge takes 45 minutes, it means you'd better remember to plug it in before you need it, like when trying to get out the door and to work on time. Another strike isn't against the shaver, but against retailers. This is a remarkable shaver, but I think its availability is limited because retailers can't make money off of cleaning solutions, but this is just my theory. That's why you'll see mostly just those Braun and Philips shavers with cleaning stations on their shelves, and not often the ones without. So the pros: - Very close shave with little/no irritation. - Ability to do a wet shave (for those who prefer this). - Remarkably (ridiculously?) easy to clean. - 45 minutes for a full charge that lasts at least half a dozen shaves. The cons: - Not being able to operate while charging (i.e. with the cord plugged in). - Limited availability for those who don't wish to purchase online or who don't want to pay for cleaning solution.
  448. First of all, I have to stress that I have no issues with the quality of the shaver. The problem is the blades. From Panasonic, they run $80, though they can be bought for just over $50. This is still far more than other shavers. The ES8243 isn't much different than the old Remington Intercept, yet the blades are more than twice the price. Panasonic is gouging us, plain and simple.

The rotary shaves every hair no matter where it is on my face. I'll never get a foil shaver again.<br /><br />After one month of using this shaver I find that it works pretty well, but I've had better shavers. I've exclusively used rotary shavers in the past. This is my first foil type shaver and also my first wet/dry shaver. So some of my gripes may be common to all foil shavers.<br /><br />Pros: Nice readout of time spent shaving. Easy to clean. Its convenient to shave in the shower. Gets a lot shaves off of a single charge. Seems well built, its quite a solid piece of machinery.<br /><br />Cons: Fairly close shave, but not as close as other shavers I've had. There are always some hairs on my neck that this shaver will never shave. I go over them a hundred times in every direction, tried it wet, dry, with shaving gel, and without. It doesn't matter, there are always a few hairs that refuse to go. I don't even try anymore and just use the razor on those. With rotary shavers I've had hairs that would take several tries to get, but they always would get cut eventually.<br /><br />Overall its good enough for me, but I'll probably be going back to a rotary shaver next time.
  452. I had been using a Braun shaver for a couple of years with excellent results (the first comfortable shave I ever found - blade or electric - in 30+ years of searching). However, it was time to replace the heads on the Braun and I had been intrigued by the Panasonic shavers (the wet shave feature) when I bought the Braun. Instead of buying the Braun replacement heads, I decided to spring for this shaver. It is a very nice shaver and I like the ability to shave in the shower. Not having to purchase the clean and renew cartridges for my Braun (a pre-7 series, 7 series shaver) was an added benefit. However, the Panasonic shaver simply doesn't provide near as comfortable shave for me as the Braun. I've been using the Panasonic for 4 months. I tried a number of shaving creams, soap, dry, before showering, in the shower, after showering, the \\"hot towel\\", light touch, medium touch, etc. but I always had some level of irritation. Plus, I routinely got shaving bumps from the shaver - something that never happened with the Braun. Thinking it may have been a sterilizing of the heads issue (the Braun's liquid uses alcohol to sterilize), I actually resorted to putting a little alcohol on the Panasonic's shaving head a few times. It didn't help. Therefore, I decided to go back to the Braun shavers. However, why go back to a 2 year old shaver? Where's the fun in that? So I ordered the Braun 790 from Amazon. It came in, I charged and cleaned it, and gave it a spin. There is just no shadow of doubt - Braun is the shaver for me. Far better for my face. Plus, even though the clean & renew cartridges are a hassle, they are well worth it to me. I like the fact that with each shave, I've got a sterilized shaver for use. Based on the excellent reviews of the Panasonic, it is undoubtedly a nice shaver - and about 1/2 the price of the Braun I am using - so nice that even though the Braun wins hands-down for me, I still rate it 4 stars. However, it just didn't workfor me.

  455. I bought this as a replacement for an Arc IV with the cleaning station (forget the exact model number - 8249 maybe?) that died after 2.5 years of really hard use. Not Panasonic's fault - I think it got voltage spiked while I was on vacation in the Caribbean and it was plugged into a 220v outlet, recharging.<br /><br />The foil is thin and the blades sharp. I did take a little adjustment period when I got the original one a few years back, but after that zero 'blade burn' or razor pimples after shaving, and I'm not that careful about only shaving after showering (e.g. not sweaty), using a skin lubricant, etc. Holds a charge good for about a week or more if I only shave my face, maybe 4 days if I also shaved my scalp every day (yes, I'm one of those baldies). Head movement and individual foil movement is good for most curvature - do have to work at getting the longer whiskers on the neck, between the chin and adam's apple by coming at it from different directions, but that's true of an actual blade razor half the time too. Trimmer is sufficient for what it does, but it vibrates so fast it tickles when I use it to trim nose hairs (ewww!).<br /><br />Anyway, great product. I'd say this one is just fine vs. the higher end one with the 'cleaning station' it is wet/dry so you just pop off the foil, rinse beneath it, rinse the foil, and maybe lightly soap it all up and re-rinse every week or two. In my case I did have the cleaning station from a prior purchase so FYI - although this particular model looks identical the 'recharging bumps' on the handle aren't really metal and this will not charge in the station for the 8249(?), it only charges when plugged in at the base.

  471. Over the years I've used just about every major shaver. From 3-4 blade razors of various brands, to Norelcos, Remingtons, and Brauns. Just before this one I was using a Braun 8000 series until it died (after several years). I have sensitive skin and most razors/shavers irritated at least my neck, until the Panasonic. This is hands down the best shave I've ever had (been using it for 2 months). It gets close without any irritation and it shaves really quickly (&lt;3 minutes).<br /><br />I also really like the fact that there is no cleaning fluid to buy. Just a little liquid soap, water, the turbo cleaning setting, and a couple of minutes will do the trick. The LED display telling how much charge is left is also very helpful as is the 1 hour to fully charged time. I've also read some reviews about how short the battery life is. I've only had it for 2 months, but it seems to be able to go about a week before needing a recharge (just under 3 minute shaves + cleaning and drying). The fact that it was about half the price of a new Braun while shaving my face better made we actually want to go so far as to write a review!<br /><br />As a side note, I haven't tried shaving with it wet yet but the fact that you can fully submerge it in water to clean it is nice. Being that I can use it wet also means it can be used with various electric shave conditioners (Afta, LectricShave, etc...) for even closer/more comfortable shaves, though I haven't needed anything like this yet.

  473. Shaving has evolved from tedious daily chore into a pleasureable task with this Panasonic wet/dry shaver. I am a 25-year cartridge razor man, after my original Norelco triple-head gave up the ghost gnawing on my tough beard. In the past I tried the first-generation Panasonic wet product only to be sorely disappointed (literally), returning it after a bad case of razor burn. However, the idea of being able to shave in the shower as well as on the go intrigued me and after reading the glowing reviews here on Amazon, I decided to give it a go again.<br /><br />The reviews are spot-on: this is a great shaver and I can get a clean close shave in just a few minutes without making a big mess. However, I've found that if I take a little more time and use some gel or even a little soap, it grooms my face more closely than I get with a regular razor. I get a week of shaves off of a one-hour charge, so I don't even have to pack the AC adapter when I head out on business trips. It takes about a month of consistent use to train your beard to get the best shaves, but you won't want to go back to a cartridge razor once you do. It's a quality product made in Japan (not China) and it performs as advertised. It will be the last shaver you'll ever buy.

  481. I rarely use electric shavers as they have never shaved as close as a blade in my opinion. That is until now! It really does shave as close as my gillette fusion system. I simply wet my face as i do with blade shaving, and start shaving for a shave as close as the blade. I have not tried using shaving foam or gel with the Arc IV, but am amazed it worked this well. The trimmer is especially useful to me also as i have sideburns. The battery seems to last a very long time too, at least 20 shaves, and the unit is very quiet compared to other braun and Norelco's i have tried.   482. I was torn between this model and the top Braun model 790CC Pulsonic (9595). The Braun is not a wet/dry model. This Panasonic usually sells for $100 here at Amazon. If it is selling for more, be patient and you'll find it for this price shortly. I do not want needless and expensive cleaning gimmicks like found on the Braun and the top Panasonic model, the ES8249K, which is identical to this model but adds the cleaning system. I can clean mine under running faucet water very easily and for free. Using this shaver is smooth and comfortable. I like it a lot. Even shaving dry, with no lubricants or anything, is great and very smooth. Unfortunately it does not shave well under my nostrils. I have to use a razor for this small area. Being a wet/dry model, you cannot use this shaver with the AC cord plugged in. This is to protect a moron user from electrocuting themselves while showering. In case the battery is depleted, you only need a 5-minute charge for a complete shave. I have tested the Braun shaver. It does shave good too, but found it feeling a bit fragile and plasticy when compared to this more robust Panasonic shaver. My research also showed that the Braun shaver is susceptible to more breakdowns and is not as heavy duty as this Panasonic shaver. Overall, I think this is the best shaver in the world. The $100 price I paid is unbeatable. I have used it for a month now, and have been extremely satisfied.

  485. I have been using Panasonic wet/dry razors for 20 years. I have always been pleased with the quality and reliability of their product. I have not purchased any of their razors over the $50 price point but that comes with drawbacks. You only get one shaving head and no indicator of how much charge is left. This time I had a couple of Amazon gift cards and used them on this model (ES8243A Arc IV Nano - Blue). I didn't want the model with the cleaning cartridge thing (that's what soap and water are for) or a large charging station taking up valuable counter space in my bathroom. After just a few uses I can't believe how close the shave actually is. I will say that even though I have used Panasonic razors all these years there is still a period of adjustment for your face and some razor burn is part of that. A big plus is the LARGE shaving head - powered by 2 razors underneath, and the digital readout displaying how much charge is left. Even if it goes to zero it takes no more than 1 hour to put it back at 100% good enough for at least 5 shaves (a big improvement on what I was using) even a 5-10 minute charge should be enough to get you by in a hurry. I am very glad I purchased it, so is my wife. Definitely worthy of 5 stars.
  486. I have a Braun 8595 yes I like it, but buying those refill cleaning kits gets expensive. I wanted a shaver that I could just rinse off. The Panasonic ES8243A Arc IV Nano men's wet/dry was the perfect choice. Great shaver very happy with this purchase. It gives me a better shave than the Braun 8595 without buying those refill cleaning kits saving me $$$$. Would I recommend this shaver YES!!
  487. This electric razor is about as close to a blade shave that you can get. I bought it to use in the shower and am not disappointed in the least. It gets very close and I like to use it with shaving soap the same way I do with a blade (on occasion). I was amazed how much more quickly it gets the job done and with little or no irritation. I have tried many different products and procedures for shaving and this is without a doubt the closest and most comfortable shave I have ever experienced with an electric razor. I would recommend this product to anyone who has a dense tough beard and has to shave daily and can be used wet or dry.
  488. This is the best electric razor I have ever used. The shave is comfortable and close. I really like the convenience of shaving in the shower with a a gel shaving product. I get about eight shaves per charge and the razor charges quickly. My only negative is the travel bag is not large enough for the power cord. I recommend this product without any reservation.
  489. Panasonic ES8243A Arc IV Nano Wet/Dry Rechargeable Shaver, Blue This is a very solid shaver. My primary use for it is not for my face, but rather my head. The general reviews implied it would be perfect as a head shaver. Upon first using it, I was a bit bewildered. It didn't seem to work at all. I had just finished taking a shower and thought I'd try the new shaver. (Before taking my shower I trimmed my hair down to stubble with a ConAir trimmer). My scalp was wet and the trimmer worked, but it didn't cut anything, or if it did cut, it was completely uneven. I was incensed at this point and thought I purchased a lemon of a shaver and proceeded to finish the shave with a Gillette Mach 3 Turbo. Right then and there I started to wonder what I would have to do to return it. I forgot about the shaver for a day. The next day, I decided to give it another try, this time with a dry head. The difference was night and day! It cut closer than my Gillette Mach 3 Turbo. I was so surprised. I shaved back and forth over my head and it was skin smooth. Cleaning is easily done by using the Turbo mode and some water. The easy to read LCD screen is handy and informative. I wonder how long the blades will last as a head shaver though? It still managed to irritate my skin a bit and gave me some redness, but it was better than nicks and cuts. Also, the ears are difficult to get around with the large square head. Most of all I'm perplexed by the performance as a wet shaver, maybe it's different for beards/scalps that are wet? Pros Very close shave Easy to clean Easy to use Charges quick Cons Easy to irritate the skin Doesn't seem to function all that well when skin is wet, at least on the scalp
  490. This is my fifth electric shaver and is the best ever; easy to clean, very close shaves and holds charge for a week. - highly recommended
  491. Ecellent shaver - found it superior to the several Brown and Norelco/Philips shavers I had during the past 20 some odd years: in less than 2 minures I get a perfect shave, with no spots missed even earound the chin and near the nose areas, I now need about 2 passes to complete the morning shave. No pulling of hair. Quiet. Easiest to clean - just hold it under the tap. Shows charge left. Realizing that different facial features and hair patterns might find other types of shavers better - for me I consider this Panasinic the best shaver I ever had.
  492. I have had electric shavers on and off for 30 years but always seem to end up back with a blade. Last 15 years I've been sold on shaving in the shower. Bonus.<br /><br />Best shaver yet.<br /><br />[UPDATED 5/1/2012]<br />Several weeks ago the LCD display that shows how long the shave has been in use and what percentage of charge is left started acting up -- it lost about 30% of what it would display. Doesn't affect how it shaves, just a bit annoying. After a full charge this weekend, the screen is completely dark -- no idea how much is left, and now I won't know when it is fully charged (it used to show 100% and flash, but now it is just a sad, dark display all the time).<br /><br />Still shaves fine, but makes me wonder how much longer the electronics will last if the display only lasted 5 months...
  493. When I first used this product the shave seemed to be smoother than my previous Panasonic. But just a few hours later I noticed a roughness indicating the hair was already coming up through the skin. My old Panasonic left my skin smooth for at least 6 hrs. This product does charge faster and holds a charge longer. I have found the shave is closer if you lock the head to prevent it from swiveling or dipping. If you use this on your privates, it will bite due to the center cutting heads. I expected more considering the price. I am also concerned how long the head casing will last as it is not too securing designed and gives the impression it will break easily.

  509. Historically, I have been a razor-guy. My hairs on my neck seem to go in all directions and traditionally, electric shaving has been tedious.<br /><br />Enter the Panasonic ES8243A. This shaver is handsomely built, with a good, solid feel to it as you hold it in your hands. The electronic display is clean and easy to read. The battery is excellent (I recommend a full charge before using, and using until it won't turn on anymore, and then another full, 10 to 12 hour charge to condition the battery properly). I shaved once a day for about 3 weeks or so before it got low again.<br /><br />The shave itself is pretty impressive. The motor is quiet and effecient, with a pleasingly high whine to let you know just how fast those blades are oscillating. I found the shave to be very close, skin tight, with miminal irritation or \\"razor burn\\". When I first bought the shaver, it required many passes at different angles on my neck hair. However, I followed the advice about using a new razor for 30 days before passing judgement, and I have noticed a marked improvement as I continued to shave every day. Now, most of the neck hair gets taken care of on the first pass, and I don't have to spend as much time going over areas with multi-directional hairs.<br /><br />I have been shaving dry for the most part, no pre-shave face washing or use of cream. This razor can handle it pretty easily. I jump out of bed and shave and I get a great, smooth face out of it.<br /><br />Tried shaving wet for the first time this morning and the shave was excellent. Hair and dirt build-up seem to be minimal and cleaning is a breeze. Just wet the foil and put some hand soap on it and activate the cleaning cycle and in less than a minute your Panasonic ES8243A is ready to go!<br /><br />While I was concerned about switching permanently to an electric razor, the Panasonic promptly put those fears to bed by giving me the best electric shave ever, and one that can compete with a razor any day! I definitely recommend giving it some time, if you are like me and have stubborn neck hairs, and you will not be disappointed.<br /><br />For the value, this is the best electric razor on the market, in my opinion.<br /><br />EDIT: Have used this product for over a month now and I still stand by my review. My neck hair is getting easier and easier to shave and it actually feels smooth to the touch!like me and have stubborn neck hairs, and you will not be disappointed. For the value, this is the best electric razor on the market, in my opinion. EDIT: Have used this product for over a month now and I still stand by my review. My neck hair is getting easier and easier to shave and it actually feels smooth to the touch!

  512. I bought this shaver because the majority of reviews I read suggested it was the best and most affordable electric shaver available. This is my first electric shaver, so I can only compare it to my experience with normal razors. I have several critiques that I believe make this electric shaver a poor choice compared to a normal non-electric razor. The shave is uneven, especially on my neck. No matter how I try, I always have to pluck a number of hairs after shaving because the electric blade cannot get them. I've tried using pre-electric shave liquids to remedy this, but to no avail. Because it is harder to get these random unshaved hairs, it also takes me longer to shave than with a normal razor. Also, I constantly get razor burn because I have to go over the same areas so many times with my razor. This is especially a problem near my Adam's apple and one I never experienced using a non-electric razor. Finally, the shape of the shaver is rather bulky (although it seems like a standard size for this type of screened electric shaver) and it makes it rather difficult to shave precisely, especially if you are trying to keep the borders of your beard even. I am quite disappointed on the whole, and I have been using this shaver for over a month a this point.
  513. Best Razor EVER. It is the closest shave you will find. Blows the Braun razor away that I had.
  514. Gives an awesome shave in the shower. And it is considerably faster at giving a clean shave than my two previous Braun shavers.<br />The shave timer is a really interesting feature.<br />After about 3 years of use, the display screen slowly started losing segments of the digits, and it is now nearly blank, but the shaver shaves on!<br />Unlike other shavers which slow down audibly as the batteries discharge, this Panasonic maintains a constant frequency until it just shuts down with low battery. Since I lost the display, I just charge the shaver whenever I notice that the shaving efficiency is slipping a little. With a full charge, the efficiency is back, and I can go typically 2 weeks of daily use before I need to recharge.<br />Other than losing the display, this is the best shaver I've ever had.

  521. I have always been a Gillette kind of guy. Every few years, I buy a high-end electric razor with the hope that the technology has improved to the point where I'll get as good a shave as with a blade, but I have been disappointed every time, until now... My new Panasonic ES8243A is the best electric razor I have found. It's fast and shaves almost as close as a blade. I recently bought a high-end Norelco Arcitec, which did a very good job, but it still couldn't do as good job below my jaw line and above my lip and took longer to shave than with the Panasonic. As long as I don't press too hard, I get no irritation from this razor. I tried it both wet and dry and much preferred using it dry. I need the hairs to stand up when I'm shaving and that doesn't happen when I use it wet. I am confident that after using it for several weeks I will get an even better shave than I am getting now. I chose not to buy the model with the automatic cleaning system and I'm very glad I did. Cleaning this razor takes about 20 seconds and all you need is a little liquid soap. There is really no point in spending the extra money for the automatic cleaning system that requires expensive cartridge refills. One more thing - it seems like every electric device you buy today recommends charging it for 24 hours before using it for the first time. The Panasonic is different - you plug it in, charge it until the light flashes telling you it has a full charge (about an hour) and then you use it. Obviously, I am very pleased with this razor and I recommend it even to guys who've been using a blade. I think Mr. Gillette will have to learn to survive without my business from now on.

I am so glad I did. I have never experienced quite a close shave as this one has provided. It literally makes my face feel as smooth as if I had used a straight edge. From the package, it had 10% battery life. It claimed it was at 100% within 40 minutes or so. I've used it for 2 days now and it still says 100%.   540. I bought this shaver for my husband who was using an older Braun which was having issues and was on it's last leg. It came to us without delay (shipping from Amazon has been excellent for all of our purchases so far). My husband has used it for several weeks and is very happy with it. The shave is closer than his old razor by far and takes less time (though he did say its not as close as a blade but said no electric razor is). It does have a higher pitch sound but not enough to wake me when he gets up before me. All in all it is worth the price which we thought was very reasonable. He has sensitive skin and would recommend this to those who also do as well as those who don't.
  541. I have been using Panasonic razors for over 10 years. Each model seems to have a few more bells & whistles or features than previous model. The shaver works as advertised. Smooth shave all in 2 to 3 minutes. I am not sure how it would compare to a Braun. And that is the only reason I didn't give it 5 stars. But being over $100 cheaper than the Braun 7 series which is not a true wet dry shaver. I am completely satisfied with the shaver as I have with previous Panasonic's that I have used. I have tried a few rotary shavers, but don't get a close shave as I do with the Panasonic.
  542. I've been using an electric shaver, a Norelco, for four years, but have been dissatisfied with the shave: It leaves unshaven or badly shaven patches, and trying to remedy that by pressing down or going over the area more frequently led to discomfort: red, irritate skin. I bought this Panasonic and my first shave out of the box was a revelation: A shave that had taken five minutes or more with the Norelco took less than three with the Panasonic, and the quality of the shave was uniformly superb, a smooth, even result that I had not gotten since I stopped using a safety razor. I couldn't be more pleased with the purchase.

All \\"worked\\" with varying idiosyncratic design and/or use features.   550. I've used a $60 Remington wet/dry shaver for a long time, as well as a Schick Xtreme blade. The Remington not only had dull blades but wasn't holding much of a charge and didn't get in the crevices very well. When your face isn't perfectly smooth, shaving every day with a blade is a pain in the neck. I wanted an electric shaver that gave a close shave but wasn't exorbitantly expensive. The reviews on this Panasonic were really good so I gave it a try. I see why the reviews were so good. It's an awesome shaver and well worth the money. First of all, it fits perfectly in the hand so that you can maneuver it without nearly dropping it. The best part is how close it shaves. I disagree with some of the reviews that it cuts as close as a blade. That's physically impossible, but it does come close. Plenty close for me to use as a daily shaver, leaving the blade for special occasions. It holds the charge for quite a long time and the display gives you all the information you would need from a shaver. I definitely recommend this item.

  559. I have a tendency to flip-flop between an electric shaver and a razor (Mach 3). Once again, I decided to go back to the electric shaver. Before doing so, I did quite a bit of research and decided on this model. The various reviews on the internet (and Amazon) were persuasive enough for me to choose this particular shaver. I can use either the wet or dry shaving method.<br /><br />When the shaver arrived, I opened the box to see what contents were there. It's relatively simple. The shaver was enclosed in the travel pouch with a plastic cover for the head. The charger next to it. On top was the documentation. I plugged the shaver in and saw that it was on zero percent power. I waited as it fully charged (just a little over an hour) and the digital readout showed 100% charge. I then tried out my new shaver and I must say, I'm completely happy with the results. One thing that I noticed in many of the reviews was that to shave with this particular model, you need to move the shaver around in a circular motion, not just up and down. Once I did that, I found that I now had a close shave, which is exactly what I was looking for!<br /><br />PROS: close shave, very intuitive (easy to use), wet/dry mode, reasonable charge time, no need for a shaver &#34;bath&#34; just place the head under running water and turn shaver on in turbo mode (press the power button and hold) to clean.<br />CONS: A small nuisance but still it needs to be pointed out: the travel bag does not have enough room for the charger. Not sure I get that.

  562. Within a couple of months the electronic display stopped working. I decided to keep it because the shave was so good and I didn't want to wait a month for the product to be fixed. Now (the razor is less than a year old), the razor stops working for no reason and also switches to the \\"clean\\" function in the middle of shaving. To make it start again in the correct mode I have to plug it into the charger for several minutes (even at full charge - which is difficult to know because the display doesn't work). For a Japanese product costing well over a $100, its a terrible purchase. Again, great shave, but I would expect the razor to last several years, not a few months.
  563. This is the best electric shaver I have ever owned. The reviews here were very helpful in leading me to try it, and I am glad I did. I have sensitive skin and a tough beard (always has taken me multiple passes and discomfort at times regardless of whether I use blade or electric). Switched from blade to electric many years ago and had to give up a close shave for less irritation. Been using a variety of Braun shavers which are the best I have found ... until now. This Panasonic is not only a lot less expensive, it gives me a much closer shave. What used to take 20-25 minutes with a Braun now takes me 15 minutes or less (don't know if I'll ever get it down to 5-10 like most folks due to my troublesome skin/whisker situation, but I am very happy with the results). It is also a breeze to clean. The only knock is it doesn't keep it's charge very long, so I pretty much have to charge it every 1-2 uses, but that's minor to me. Also, some of the other reviewers mentioned dry versus wet, using pre-shave products, etc. I tried dry, and it doesn't get as close, but for quick touchups it works well. I tried a couple different types of pre-electric lotions, and it helps me get a closer shave, but the best for me is just using plain water - really gives me the closest and most comfortable shave. I highly recommend this shaver especially for those like me who have always had a tough time finding a shaver that gets a close shave, is comfortable and little or no skin irritation, is quick, and is easy to use and clean.

  568. Closest shave I've ever had w/ an electric razor. I've found Norelco's blades to be slow and they pull (and hurt!) when shaving longer hair. The Braun I used was better in that regard since the speed of its blades are much greater, but the whole shaver vibrated something fierce and it didn't shave particularly closely. The Panasonic's blades move at a much, much higher speed than either of those. None of that vibration is transmitted to the rest of the shaver and as a result it's much quieter than the others. It only takes me 3 to 4 minutes to shave in the morning and it does a great job. Well done Panasonic!
  569. This is definitely one of the best, if not THE best, shavers I've ever had. I have had for about 2 years with no problems whatsoever and don't anticipate any. Thanks for making such a great product.

Then about three weeks in he started getting cuts and nicks and the razor burn on his neck area was getting bad. he has an old norelco that i paid 20 dollars for at Walmart 10 years ago that never once cut or nicked him! I've never heard of this happening from an electric razor. he hasn't used it now in 4 days and he still has scabs on his upper lip from where it cut deep in 3 places. this was from normal use, he wasn't even pressing hard, needless to say, i'm returning this today after his 3 and a half weeks of misery, he says he thinks he'll have better results from my cheese grater. save yourself the $100.00+ and look else where.

  581. This was the first electric shaver I bought and was pretty excited to get to use it. Once I got it I couldn't wait to try it out because the reviews I found about it were great. I would have patches where it just wouldn't cut and ended up having to rub it over the same spot for 5 minutes or would give up and just get out my razor blade. To me, if you can't get the neck hairs its pretty useless and its past the 30-day money back guarantee so I can't return it now either. I would say if you are looking into buying an electronic shaver for the first time check to see if the reviews mention neck hairs because those are the hardest spots to reach.
  582. This is the 3rd panasonic razor similar to this one I have owned. I have replaced them only due to the battery eventually wearing out after several years. I have pretty bad in grown hairs on my neck and after your skin is used to an electric razor it does fine. One thing this razor does not do that the other foil razors I have owned is cut your skin. Does this cut as close as a Mach 3? Of course not! No electric razor does. I am sick of people comparing electric razors to regular ones. I can shave in my truck on the way to work (and I shave my head too and it works great) Can you do that with a regular razor/no shaving cream? I know people are going to argue this, but honestly if you want the closest best shave then do it the old fashoined way. If your like me and are always in a hurry and like to multitask.... Then buy this. You will not be disappointed.

  584. This is the first electric shaver I have used. I used a Gillette Fusion razor before that. I did a decent amount of research before buying this one. When I initially started using this shaver (little more than a month ago), it did a very good job on the face, but really struggled on the neck (there were patches of hair it could not remove) - trying it wet or with a regular shaving cream did not help either. I put too much pressure and tried repeatedly, but that did not improve results (just as the manual says), it only caused irritation. The manual also says you need to wait about 30 days to see improved results (so do others, with experience with an electric shaver), so that your skin and hair get \\"used\\" to it. Even though I was disappointed at first, and wanted to return it, I patiently waited for 30 days, even though waiting past 30 days would mean it will be beyond the returnable time limit. Gradually, it started doing a better job on the neck. Now, I can get an excellent, close shave (just like an excellent razor), without applying any pressure, and without any irritation, both on my face and neck. Dry seems to work better than wet or with a regular shaving cream, for me. However, the best results were with a pre-electic shave lotion - closest shave (even on the neck), least effort, least irritation and least amount of time spent. Pros: + Excellent, close shave (face and neck), like an excellent razor + Very little effort required; easy and convenient to use and carry (comes with a travel case) + No shaving cream required; also does a very good job dry + Does a phenomenal job with an electric pre-shave lotion + No irritation, no cuts + Not messy - most of the cut hair stays inside + Very quick - usually takes about 2.5 minutes for me; it has a timer + Very easy to clean - just remove foil, and rinse both foil and blades in running water (an expensive, elaborate and cumbersome cleaning system is not required) + Enough charge - I can get at least 15 to 20 shaves on 1 charge (no need to take your charger with you on most trips); charges very quickly + Money saved on expensive regular razor blades - I believe you need to seldom replace this electric shaver's foil and blades (at a reasonable price) + Excellent value for money Cons: - requires at least 30 days to start showing good results, especially on the neck (in my case) Overall, an excellent product (as you would come to expect from Panasonic), however I had to be very patient for a little more than 30 days, and had to resist the urge to return it. Worth every dollar - I thoroughly enjoy using it! Much more convenient and quicker shave than a regular razor, without the mess, cuts or irritation!
  585. I am pleased with this shaver. It met all of my expectations. It far outstripped a Braun shaver which I had recently purchased and have junked.

  587. In my search for the best electric shaver, I have tried various Braun and Norelco shavers. The Braun models did an excellent job with the mustache area, a good job with the facial area, but a terrible job with the neck. The Norelco models did a much better job with the neck area, a good job with the facial area, but not as good for the mustache area. Almost reverse from the Braun results. I stayed with Noreclo for years but was extremely disappointed with the Sensotouch 3D model and switched back to my older Norelco model. When I decided to purchase a new shaver I purchased the Panasonic ES8243A. Finally, the electric shaver that gives me an excellent shave for the mustache area, facial area, and neck area! Trimmer works great (one of the worse features for the Sensotouch). Clean-up is quick and simple. Battery indicator lets you know when to charge so you never lose power during the shave. The only negative is it is definitely the loudest electric shaver that I have owned but the minor inconvenience is worth it for the excellent shave.

  591. So let me start out by saying that I hate shaving. Its such a waste of time and energy. I specifically hate shaving with a razor. The process of getting your face wet applying shaving cream and then cleaning up after myself is particularly daunting especially in the morning where I just want to get out the door and get to work on time. Secondly I have a younger looking face so if I don't shave I look like a 25 year old homeless man.<br /><br />So here I go. Be under no illusion that this device can give you as close of a shave as a razor would. Let me precede this by mentioning that when I shave with a razor (mac 3) I shave against the hair so when I do go to the razor its a very close shave. I, however, don't care to have a close shave unless I'm doing something special like going out to dinner with my wife or going to some nice event. In the rest of the cases I just want the majority of that itchy facial hair to be at a minimum and to avoid my \\"homeless\\" look. Thats where the Panasonic wet/dry comes into play. I love it. It takes me about 2-3 minutes to shave with no cleanup no shaving cream, nothing. So much easier than having to get my face wet and all that other stuff. Its so easy to cary around and I just throw it in my travel bag whenever I am going anywhere. The nice thing is also that I don't need after shave afterwards (where as when using a razor I definitely do). I justs shave and go. That said I have to mention that the quality of the shave is not as good as compared to a razor. On my checks and around my lips I get a clean enough and close enough shave but around my neck, especially around my adams apple, it tends to miss stuff and I have to do multiple passes. With the curviness of my neck it tends to have a bit more problems and I have to go over the same spot a few times if I want to get everything. In general I don't care that much about that area since I just want to look semi presentable.<br /><br />Battery life is really good. I usethe thing once a day or once every other day and I feel like I need to charge it about once every two or three weeks. Cleaning it is a breeze. Just shove it under water or if you really want pop the top off (super simple) and run some water over it. Cleaning takes me less than 10 seconds.<br /><br />Over all this thing is a great time saver. Its not as good as shaving with a razor but I don't need that clean of a look all the time so for me its a perfect middle ground device. I wouldn't trade it for anything.

  593. This is my first foil shaver. It shaves OK (not great) but is quite noisy compared to the Norelcos I've used previously. I like the cleaning system. My next shaver purchase likely will be a Norelco.
  594. The shaver has replaced a Braun one that'd been in my possession for almost 4 years and the change is for the better. With Braun (not a cheap one) I've had a small but persistent irritation under the chin. Nothing like that with this Panasonic; it just removes the growth and that is it. And that is what I want from it. The head is noticeably larger than the head on the Braun and it took me a few minutes to develop a proper shaving technique; life is better now. The proposed cleaning procedure looks scary on paper but is actually very unsophisticated and is quite entertaining - you get to watch how liquid soap gets foamed up right before your eyes, and how it moves about, and how the foam gets less and less clean as it removes stuff from the blades; and it takes less than a minute to clean the shaver. The battery holds the charge well. The time between charges is variable, but I'd say that I need to charge it every other week; that is with frequent cleanups. Thumbs up so far.
  595. This is my husbands first electric shaver. And he is so in love with this shaver, he uses it every morning and boost how good it is.
  596. OK - I bought this razor 10 months ago in December of 2010 and after 10 months of using it I can honestly say this was a waste of money. Really, I could have told you that after 4 months but I never got around to posting a review and an extra 6 months has only firmed my opinion that I wasted my money. First - let me share that I do not have a heavy beard at all. I have light hair and I have never been accused of having a 5 o'clock shadow. Heck, I don't have a shadow the next morning if I shave with a blade. When I have a beard, the hair is finer than most mens. I do know that after the first 30 days I thought about writing a review and at that time I would have given it 4 stars. I would have taken 1 star off because the closeness of the shave was not as good as my Norelco rotary that had just died. However, it was fine at 30 days. The shave lasted the day. Now? Its almost a joke. The shave does not last until the end of my work day. I get home and neither my wife or my kids want to kiss me as my face feels like sand paper to them. When I am done shaving, its not even that close. I stop because I'm tired of running the shaver over my face. There are several places on my neck that it completely misses after a few days I find I have to use a blade to get the long hairs it keeps missing. I have to use the blade often after my shave anyway just to get to some spots. And if I am doing anything important where a shave is important? I use a blade. I would not recommend this to any one. Heck, if I came across a brand new one of these laying in the street, I would not pick it up. I can only imagine that the bulk of the 4/5 start reviews were written by people in the first 30 days, when it works fairly well. For me - I will go back to the Norelco rotary next time, which will be soon.
  597. This shaver provides a smooth shave. Whether or not it is better than my 9-year old Norelco I cannot tell -- how much has the Norelco improved? My only disappointment (compared to my old Norelco) is a short battery life between recharges. The literature refers to a \\"3-minute shave\\" in it's computations. In my opinion and experience, this shaver excels in wet mode with a bit of hot water and shaving cream slathered on the face. It effortlessly glides over your beard, leaving a baby skin smoothness in only 1 or 2 passes. No irritation whatsoever. I use it in the shower where the steam and hot water seems to soften the beard nicely. Love the fact that it's made for shower or wet shaves at the sink.<br /><br />I used to hate shaving (both with blades and other electric shavers). Now (if you can believe this), I look forward to shaving with the ES8243A. Clean-up is a snap with popping off the foil and rinsing the blades in hot water for a few seconds.<br /><br />This was a great purchase from Amazon with no regrets.<br /><br />UPDATE (6/1/2012): 6 months later the motor started to have weird behavior. The motor would oscillate from low to high speed, and the shaver would then pinch the skin when trying to shave. I called Panasonic support, who had me send it back for warranty service at my expense ($12).<br /><br />2-3 weeks later Panasonic mailed me what looked like a new, sealed box with labeling saying it was made and imported from Japan. The shaver inside was sealed in plastic as if brand new. It worked well for a month and then the original problem returned. The motor would oscillate between low and high speed and it wouldn't shave. It looks to me like there's a design flaw with the foil and how it attaches to the shaver, as the motor runs fine with the foil removed.<br /><br />I called Panasonic again, and mentioned that the same problem returned. I half jokingly said maybe they just sent me the original problem unit back the first time. Surprisingly, the rep said that just may well be what happened. I was directed to send this second one back at my expense. I'm about ready to give up. Downgrading from 5 to 2 stars (would be 1 star but I'm not sure it's a universalproblem or just me).
  603. Pros: 1. Good shaving in General 2. Fast charging battery and long lasting batteries 3. Easy to clean compared to Philips Norelco 1250x/40 SensoTouch 3d 4. Well made 5. Good in we/dry shaving Cons 1. Not very good around neck line, Philips Norelco 1250x/40 SensoTouch 3d gives better shaving in this area 2. Philips Norelco 1250x/40 has a smoother shaving compared to this one
  604. I've owned three Braun shaving systems that were much more expensive than the ES8243A. The Panasonic out performs the Braun hands down.
  605. This shaver is like a high revving Sport Bike Motorcycle engine in a lawnmower. I simply move the razor up and down one row after another on my face and the hair is gone. There is no need to go over the area twice; and the only reason I do is because I'm obsessive/compulsive. What a great product! The only negative I can say is about myself: Why did I take so long to find this shaver? P. S. Amazon is fantastic. They make buying a product so easy that when it arrives you can only stand in awe of their expertise. I have now bought several things through Amazon and will only buy from them--E Bay who? Thanks Amazon for giving me another purchasing option on the Internet. I like you more than Zappos, and I like Zappos a lot.
  606. Purchased this item for our son who never used an electric shaver.After using it for the first time he said he would probably never use a regular razor again. He said it shaved closer and smoother than a regular razor!! Awesome product.
  607. The Panasaonic shaver is a great product that can be used underwater for a close shave. I have been using them for the past 15 years and they keep on getting better each time.
  608. I've been using Panasonic razors for many years and the ES8243 is arguably the best yet. My only complaint is the high price of the replacement head and blade kits. My first Panasonic was an ES8065 that with new head and blades can still rival the latest Panasonics. Assuming that Panasonic's razor technology would evolve forward over time, I later purchased an ES8092 that, for whatever reason, turned out to be somewhat of a disappointment in cutting performance, not at all comparable to the ES8065. The ES8243 restored my faith in Panasonic razors with superb cutting performance. The only issue is the absurdly high-priced replacement head and blade kit. You almost might was well buy a new razor instead.<br /><br />Note: I was a dry shaver for years. I suppose I was a traditionalist. But with the ES8092's poor cutting performance, I experiemented with lectric shave and Afta. These products work, but I disliked having to wash them off my face afterwards. I finally took the plunge with my ES8243 and began wet shaving (with Aveeno shave gel). I'm sold on this being the best way to shave, and get the most out of one's Panasonic razor.<br /><br />Update: I'm still satisfied and feel Panasonic shavers are the best electric shavers currently available. But I have a thought. The performance of Panasonic's blade and foil design depends on high quality (expensive) metals. However, while the price of such metals has risen much over the last 5 years, the market won't accept price increases from Panasonic. Their shaver pricing hasn't changed much over the last 3 years. So something has to give somewhere. I suspect blade quality isn't as high as years past, resulting in lower performance and shorter life. This is my humble thought, I may be all wrong.<br /><br />Update 2: After a little more than a year of use, the upper half of the LEDs of the \\"percent remaining\\" number have failed. Having just changed the foil and blades after one year of use, to have this happen, I'm disappointed. From my personal experience with Norelco and Braun, I still prefer Panasonic. BUT, the quality isn't what it used to be.<br /><br />With that in mind, since I have not witnessed any benefit to the ES8243A's 4-blade design, and the replacement foil/blade kit is absurdly expensive, I plan to replace this with the more affordable 3-blade ES8103S. My older 3-blade razors (e.g. ES8065) cut great with the Panasonic 3-blade design.<br /><br />Update 3: The LED display is unreadable. Half the LEDs don't function. I'm very disappointed. My earlier Panasonic razors never had any failures. I simply needed to buy a new blade and foil kit every year. Panasonic's design quality has clearly changed. If I can make it to year-end, I'll buy the ES8103S at that time because its purchase and re-blade costs are more reasonable. I certainly have not found any advantage in the higher priced ES8243A.<br /><br />Recommendation: Shaving in the shower with shaving gel, although I take off the head and rinse the head and foil well, over time I noticed an almost invisible build-up that seems to bind the head's moving parts. I now soak the head in a glass of white vinegar every month and it safely disolves away the shaving cream/gel residue.d. From my personal experience with Norelco and Braun, I still prefer Panasonic. BUT, the quality isn't what it used to be.<br /><br />With that in mind, since I have not witnessed any benefit to the ES8243A's 4-blade design, and the replacement foil/blade kit is absurdly expensive, I plan to replace this with the more affordable 3-blade ES8103S. My older 3-blade razors (e.g. ES8065) cut great with the Panasonic 3-blade design.<br /><br />Update 3: The LED display is unreadable. Half the LEDs don't function. I'm very disappointed. My earlier Panasonic razors never had any failures. I simply needed to buy a new blade and foil kit every year. Panasonic's design quality has clearly changed. If I can make it to year-end, I'll buy the ES8103S at that time because its purchase and re-blade costs are more reasonable. I certainly have not found any advantage in the higher priced ES8243A.<br /><br />Recommendation: Shaving in the shower with shaving gel, although I take off the head and rinse the head and foil well, over time I noticed an almost invisible build-up that seems to bind the head's moving parts. I now soak the head in a glass of white vinegar every month and it safely disolves away the shaving cream/gel residue.
  609. I have been shaving with Panasonic shavers for about 6 years now, I settled on the panasonic brand after trying Norelco and remington, I feel that the panasonic shaves better for me. My previous panasonic models were the 8066 that I used for 3 years then got replaced with the ES8163 which has worked flawlessly for about 3 years now, the only complaint on the 8163 is that the LCD screen doesn't work after 3 years of daily use but does not interfere with the performance. I decided to upgrade to the new Arc Nano 4 ES8243 after seeing very good reviews on the electric razor forums and from previous positive experience with this brand, I just got it and all I can say is WOW! This new model shaves way better than the 8163 I had! I feel that the shave is closer and more confortable, wet or dry it shaves more closely than previous models with less irritation and no burns specially in the neck area and jaw. This model also feels lighter than the 8163 and is less noisy. The pictures posted on Amazon does not do this shaver justice!!! This blue shaver is gorgeous! The only Con I see is that they should have included a charging base as the 8163 had, nothing fancy just a nice base, and drop the price of the screens and blades to around $30'ish this would be an even sweeter deal. If you are on the fence on one of these, I suggest you go for it and buy it, you won't regret it. Thanks! AlexGT
  610. I am satisfied with this shaver since the first time I used it. I was looking for a shaver that really makes the shaving process an agreable one.
  611. I have several electric shavers - always looking to try out something new. Up until now, my best shave was from the Norelco Arcitec line. Well, the Arcitec has been put aside in favor of the Arc IV.<br /><br />I used a Panasonic a couple of years ago (one of their lower-end models) and found it gave a pretty good shave when used wet, but a so-so shave when used dry. It was particularly poor on the neck and jaw line, areas where the Arcitec really shines. It was a very comfortable shave, but the Panny got passed along to my nephew since I mostly tend to shave dry.<br /><br />Heard that the Arc IV had some notable improvements, so I thought I'd check it out (especially since it was on sale). I'm pleased to report that the improvements are real -- the dry shave is far better than before, especially on the neck area. Just as gentle as the Braun Pulsonic, but far closer. Perhaps even a wee bit closer than the Norelco, and certainly more gentle on the face than a rotary.<br /><br />The build quality is excellent -- very solid with a non-slip grip. The screen area gives info on charge status which is very helpful (does it in percent of charge left). Recharge time is great (under 1 hour for a total discharge to total charge status).<br /><br />This razor is one of the easiest to clean, so save some money and get this model rather than the model with the cleaning station. I've used the Panasonic cleaning stations and, while they are better than the ones offered by Remington and Norelco, they are way behind what Braun offers. You'll get the razor just as clean -- and usually cleaner -- if you clean it under the tap (just a couple of drops of liquid soap, run it in turbo mode, quick rinse, and you're done). Since the razor is built to be used in the shower, you don't have to be careful as you are with other razors when rinsing it off under the tap.<br /><br />Excellent shave, easy to clean, quick to charge, and comfortable to use. Five stars!!

  629. After struggling for years to get a nice close, clean shave with an inexpensive electric shaver I finally broke down and spent a few extra dollars to get a better razor. Man, am I glad I did! I would constantly have to go over and over the same spot to try and get all the neck hairs cut close, finally I would pop open the trimmer, cut the long hairs, then go over the spot with the razor...a complete waste of time! In about 180 seconds I had my whole face and neck shaved without irritation or struggle! It took me about 5 minutes daily to get a \\"decent\\" shave with my Braun. I'll never go back to using a razor as long as a Panasonic wet/dry shaver is available.   642. I hate shaving, and I bought the Panasonic ES8243A a few months ago to make the process more convenient. I have never previously owned an electric shaver because I had always heard the standard refrain that you can't get a good, close shave with them. After some extensive use now, I'm pleasantly surprised. I think this shaver debunks that common argument: I have gotten shaves with the ES8243A that are just as close as I ever got with blade shavers. It takes some getting used to, but after you are conditioned to it, the results are great. To get the closest shaves, it's necessary to use a pre-shave treatment (I use Lectric Shave), but I definitely prefer this over using shaving cream with a blade razer. Aside from fantastic results, the shaver is pretty convenient and requires minimal maintenance. The wet/dry option allows great versatility for use in the shower or on the run; the battery life is fantastic (I probably get about 15-20 uses between each charge); and cleanup is simple (a few seconds of washing with cold water and soap). If you're on the fence, take the leap. This is a fantastic product!
