  1259. I used to like Braun shavers up until their later 7000 and 8000 series shavers. As a result, I've been looking for a replacement shaver that does as well as Braun used to. I purchased a [[ASIN:B00176V2SK Panasonic ES8228S Men's Linear Vortex Nano Arc Foil Shaving System, Silver]] last year with two foils and an 'A' outer foil design. Then I saw that this one was on the deal of the day. So, I ordered. While I like this shaver better than another Panasonic that I have for the shave quality, I don't like that it's noisier than the other Panasonic. Basically, the A7 design isn't that great on this razor. The back of the shaver design pushes down and rattles against itself. However, barring this annoying noise, the shaver does work well and, in fact, works better than the previous Panasonic I bought. That said, it doesn't work as well as the best Braun that I've owned. Except that Braun's new razor designs now are far worse than this razor.<br /><br />From my previous Panasonic shaver, I have a cleaning system base. I was hoping that this razor would at least charge and/or clean in that existing base. Nope. It doesn't. That said, you can at least put the razor in the base with the dryer setting. So, you can wash the razor by hand and put it into the base and set it to dry. I wish these razor manufacturers would realize that offering a separate cleaning system base (that's compatible with all of their razors) is something that makes sense financially (an upsell option) and let's consumers replace a broken base or buy a better razor. Basically, they should make one style cleaning base that fits all razors even if the base design and features itself changes.<br /><br />Pros: Good shave, easy to use, three foils, trimmer, long battery life, wet/dry, can be washed easily<br />Cons: Noisy, rattles (bad head design), no cleaning system included (won't even charge in one you may already own), doesn't fit existing clean systems

  1263. Prior to purchasing this model, I purchased a Panasonic ES8103 for about half the price. I decided to purchase this one and keep the other in my travel bag and for back-up. I see marks on my shaven head as I use the shaver but they are temporary when they do occur. All in all, I wish I had purchased a second ES8103. Prior to the Panasonic products I used a Philips / Norelco Rotary head razor. They were great razors with better battery life but once I began shaving my head each day, the razor rash on my neck was just too much. I thought my neck would get used to the triple header Norelco but it did not. Both Panasonic models do not and never did bother my neck. I'll take having to charge the Panasonic units at least every week over the neck burn. So now it's now one year after purchase and the head on this unit broke. The shaver foil on one end of one side of the head will no longer stay down. The design on this shaver head is very flimsy. In an attempt to to make a wider shaver head, Panasonic failed on this one. In addition, it's much too clumsy to be effective. Amazon was very supportive in helping me take care of this as it has a two year warranty. Today my second ES103 arrived. It is actually called an ES103S now but is essentially the same model. This will be my daily shaver and the older one will be for travel and backup. My recommendation is now even stronger to avoid this model and go for the ES103S. Hope this helps.

I then moved on to a couple of different Eltrons, great razors in their time, well before Braun dominated the market. The last 3 or 4 have been Brauns. The other one is an 8975 that is about 5 years old. I change the blades every 90 days and always use the cleaning system. I am a huge fan of the cleaning system. This Panasonic blows away the Brauns. If the more expensive Panasonics are better than this one then I will graduate at some point. This razor shaves FASTER, CLOSER and with GREATER COMFORT. It seems that the blades are sharper but maybe it is the higher RPM or greater torque I have no idea. The location of the trimmer is not as good as the Braun but who cares, the trimmers on both Brauns are broken just like on previous ones that I have owned. I have fairly heavy beard but certainly not the heaviest. Probably about a 3.5-4.0 on a 1-5 scale. Again in closing: Faster, closer and more comfort. Highly recommend.

  1277. I have been using an electric shaver for about 20 years and was on my second Braun when I decided it was time for a change. I hadn't realized what shaving my light-to-medium beard had become - a combination of the Braun electric shaver AND a blade to get the difficult areas as well as the close shave I desired. Sometimes when I used the blade I ended up with nicks. Suddenly it dawned on me that there surely must be a better way in the 21st century so I set off to find a reasonably priced wet/dry shaver that would do the job.<br /><br />The reviews for the Panasonic ES8243A Men's 4-Blade shaver were overwhelmingly good so I took the plunge. Having never used a wet rechargeable shaver before, I was intrigued. My first shave was a dry one and it certainly outperformed my old Braun. This morning I decided to give it a try on the wet shave and let me tell you - I got the MOST INCREDIBLE, CLOSEST SHAVE that I've had in years!!!!! As smooth as a baby's bottom and it handled my \\"problem\\" areas around the corner of my mouth and immediately under my nose. I decided to use a clear shaving gel so I purchased Gillette Fusion ProGlide clear gel and followed the directions. Rather than shaving in the shower, I shaved before getting in the shower. I then just rinsed the shaving head and was done. This was at 9 a.m. and it is now almost 5 pm and I can't feel any whiskers poking up yet. Still very smooth.<br /><br />The Panasonic shaver is relatively quiet (as compared to my previous Braun shavers) and is lightweight and easy to use. The travel pouch looks useful and handy to have rather than rattling around in one's sponge bag. I know - after TWO shaves I'm completely sold. I got an excellent dry shave and an OUTSTANDING wet shave with this shaver. I'm sure results will differ dependant upon beard type, etc. I would recommend this shaver without hesitation.
  1278. My Norelco was dying on me so I was giving thought to switching. Actually I was agonizing over it. The fear of the unknown. I've used Norelco rotary razors for that past 30 years or more. Tried blade shaving a few years ago and just seemed to cut myself almost every time. Invested in good blades, brushes and creams but still couldn't get the blade thing down without cuts. My new Panasonic is quicker and closer than the Norelco. Darned near as close as I could get with the blade. Although it is a bit louder than the Norelco it isn't really annoying. Clean up is quick and easy.<br /><br />I've always had a tough, quick growing beard. This mows through it and I am finishing my shave in, usually, under 3 minutes. Have used is with some of my shave cream as a wet shaver and those shaves have been very close. Obviously takes longer but was very happy with the results. Also, going a week or more between charges. Would recommend this for sure.
  1279. I am in my sixties, have been a professional soldier and police officer, many fights, many scars.<br />Past electric razors have never cut my beard growth close enough to \\"pass muster\\", and blades always cut my many scars,(LOL)..<br /><br />This Panasonic cuts my beard growth in three minutes as close as a blade, without cutting my face!! I am amazed and pleased to have found this great little friend..<br /><br />Cannot go wrong with this razor for yourself, or as a gift..

  1281. Has a nice close shave and it works in the shower as advertised. Very happy with this purchase. Would Recommend.
  1282. Having dealt with Remingtion and Norelco for many many years, I had come to expect the same old same old from shavers. I took a chance on this new technology from Panasonic. And I could not have been more pleased. It would appear to me that R and N are milking their old technology and customers for as much as they can get, without innovating. This Panasonic shaver is truly new and much better. I believe this arises from the faster motor and linear technology. The difference is that R and N are like a lawnmower, and the Panasonic is like a fine cutting instrument. The most significant improvement for me arises from: relief from razor burn, fast shave, cuts tough beard, charges fast, cutters last a long time, much easier to clean. In all of these areas, the Panasonic outshines N and R. I have also tried Braun. But this technology is superior. The cutting head is also a new technology. It is as if Panasonic has left the others behind in the dust, almost like Apple versus the PC world. We need to encourage such innovation in a field that has been dominated by laggards for over half a century. Best of luck to you.
  1283. Been shaving with the standard safety razor for 50 years. After much comparison shopping, I selected the Panasonic ES8243A. I just love the wet shave feature. It may take a little longer to get a complete shave but the wear and tear of the safety razor on my face is eliminated. It's a breeze to clean.<br /><br />Very happy with my choice.

  1286. It takes several good minutes until it shaves away all the hair. Battery lasts for about 4-5 shaves at most.
  1287. This is the second electric shaver I started using after many years of using a blade. I use it exclusively dry. This gives me a good close shave, even around the bottem of my chin which has always been a problem spot. The spacing of the blades on the head of the shaver are a little to far apart to work on problems areas like the jaw, so you are really relying on one blade for these places, otherwise on the large areas it works well. The reason I didn't give it 4 stars is that it doesn't work which it is being charged. Also, when you clean it in water (which is the only way to clean it since the blade cannot be removed) you still have to run a Q-Tip around the base of the blades, and you have to let it dry overnight. I suppose I don't really have to let it dry all the way since it is a wet shaver too, but I tried using the shaver wet and didn't like the feel. Picky me.
  1288. I have been using Norelco for over 15 years and thought new technology would have come along to improve the shave so I hunted and after reading about this one I was sure it would be better. I will dig my Norelco out of the going to Goodwill box and continue to use that. This one will be my back-up. I just wish they would all make the batteries easier to replace. I don't like soldering in new ones but they last for years so I will still do that.

  1296. Guys, I purchased this Pani Wet/Dry ES8243 in September of 2011 and it is still running strong. Right now, with daily facial use it will still go over week before needing to be recharged. I haven't noticed any reduction in the battery life since I've owned it. In the past I've had some frustrating situations with electric shavers that would die during the middle of a business trip, etc. many of them just a year old. So far so good with this one.<br /><br />I have thicker than normal hair. I don't think it is the thickest, but every hair stylist I go to comments on how thick my hair is. Last Christmas my mother-in-law commented to my wife about how thick my son's hair was and my wife had to assure her that it was normal and he gets it from me. Before purchasing this shaver I used Gillette Mach 3s and would run through replacement packs frequently because it was the only way I could actually go through the day and have a 5 o'clock shadow not show up early. Other electric shavers would never get close enough to give me that truly &#34;clean shaven&#34; look. This shaver is the closest thing I've found to a straight razor or a manual razor like the Mach 3. It really is a good shave.<br /><br />I've used the shaver in both wet and dry conditions and in both it works really well, most of the time though I'm shaving dry. The shaver itself is a great machine.<br /><br />The screen read out is orange (kind of an odd color), but it is clear and tells you the battery life, time used for the shave, and a heads up when it needs to be cleaned.<br /><br />The inside of the shaving head is really just two shaving foils (you can see the picture on the amazon product images) which catch and cut the hairs that fall through the outer two &#34;blades.&#34; Attached to the two internal foils are two arms which engage the two inner &#34;blades&#34; when it turns on. The lower inner blade (nearer to the face with on/off buttom) is designed to catch finer hair and the upper inner blade is designed for the thicker, longer stubble (nearer to the back where the flip-up long hair trimmer is). The flip-up trimmer has worked great for cleaning up hair around/on ears and sideburns.<br /><br />The charging cable is pretty basic straight cable. I wish it was more of a sturdy coil style with a thicker gauge wire, but so far it hasn't been an issue and continues to work fine. That is just me being picky.<br /><br />I saw that it was coming up on the Black Friday deals and figured I'd do a write up in case any of you were looking at it. It is a worth while purchase if you are in the market or are looking to take a break from doing the longer routine of a razor. It would be a great Christmas present for a wife to get her husband too.
  1297. I have had this razor for three years and have bought them for my 2 boys two years ago and their razors, and they love it too. I have had Norelco, Remmington and Braun razors, (before Braun was bought by Remmy). Simply put you will be happy with this razor. I will buy this model for my 85 year old Dad this year a product of quality that has not changed. That alone is hard to find these days.<br /><br />The benefits are topped by a 13k rpm for less pulling, (the #1 reason to buy), also it's easy to clean, blades and screen seem to last longer, quality, good ergo dynamics, simple rinse to clean, nothing extra to buy. Quality you don't find in others.

  1310. 20 years ago I decided not to try electric razors again. They were too painful and the shaving process was too slow. I decided to give it one more try after a long evaluation and having friends assuring the technology had improved. After a long research I selected the Panasonic ES8243A. I have to say that I am really impressed with this razor. When I was using manual razors I had to shave, at the most, twice per week due to my very sensitive skin. With the ES8243A I'm shaving every day. The shaver produces a very smooth and close shave with no irritation. I went from hating shaving to loving it and actually looking forward for a clean and shaved face every day of my life. I have recommended this shaver to my coworkers and friends. Highly recommended.<br /><br />For best shaving results, I use the following shaving process:<br />1. Wash face with Aveeno Face Wash (cost about $5 the tube, lasts a long time)<br />2. Apply Electric Razor Pre-Shave solution to face. I use the one Walgreens sells, which compares to Williams Lectric Shave ($5 the bottle)<br />3. Shave using the Panasonic ES8243A<br />4. Wash face with water and apply Aveeno After Shave Lotion.<br />5. Clean the shaver when it tells you to do it (around once per week, carefully follow the shaver instructions to properly clean it.)<br /><br />I have tested other methods and products (e.g. Baby powder, gels, dry, wet, other face wash brands, other pre-shave lotions, etc, etc..) but this is absolutely the best that worked for me. Note: I am an engineer so testing and evaluating is part of my DNA.<br /><br />One final thing, any electric razor will produce irritation if you don't follow the correct shaving process. This one is no exception. So follow the steps listed above and clean your shaver regularly.<br /><br />Hope you enjoy a clean shaven face as much as I am enjoying mine now.
  1311. This is my 4th electric razor. I have extremely coarse hair and when I shave in the AM I have a &#34;12 o'clock shadow&#34;. Unlike most people's descriptions, this did not get anywhere near &#34;1 pass shave&#34;. I usually had to make many passes before I didn't feel any stubble. The wet-dry feature is nice. After almost 2 years of operation the back-side trimmer stopped working. I have been shaving only once a week because I don't like the irritation. I use the back-trimmer first then the razor. So this got low-to-moderate usage. Still, 2 years is longer than any other electric razor has lasted me.<br /><br />3 stars because it did its job, not 4 or 5 because it did not do as good a job as claimed and took me about 10-15 minutes to get a good shave with this thing shaving once a week (it only takes 2-5 minutes with a straight-razor). I don't use shaving cream ever so I don't know if that had any effect on the duration/effectiveness of this razor, I just use water when the razor permits.

  1325. This razor is great. To use it I wet down my face good with hot water, and then it glides smoothly and easily over my skin. It's fast, easy to use, pain free (unlike a blade, which is what I was using for years), doesn't need messy shaving cream or pre shave lotions, lets me get close to my lips without fear of nicks, and overall is a great product. It doesn't irritate my skin at all, if I want to touch up my shave at the end of the day before going out, no problem, and no worries about shaving over skin still irritated from a shave earlier in the day. It is also easy to clean. I just pop off the top and run hot water over the blades at the end of every shave, and shake off the excess water.

  1337. My past shavers have all been 2 or 3 head Remington Titanium or Braun (or a razor blade for days I let it grow out). This was my first Panasonic. Like the Titanium best. I was wrong. I dry shave in the morning and sometimes at night as well. I like a real close smooth shave. Have had the new Panasonic for a month. Used it only. Brush cleaned it after each shave. So far no major issues.<br /><br />PROs<br />Attractive looks and color<br />Controls easy to use and understand<br />Ergonomics good for hand holding<br />Fairly close shave, not many stray hairs<br />Holds charge for a long time<br />Easy to clean<br />Lights on front panel are entertaining, power level light is useful.<br /><br />CONs<br />A little bit bigger than I expected, my others have the same shape but are smaller in overall size<br />Takes twice the time to shave now - must go slow and repeat previously shaved areas (lengthy process)<br />High pitch whine that can be irritating at times as you shave<br />Screen can be a little rough, not as smooth feeling to the skin as my Titanium ones<br />Head gets a little hot after awhile, so that is noticeable and sometimes uncomfortable<br />Areas shaved come back out real fast<br />Areas shaved come back in mid afternoon very rough & sharp feeling (scratchy stubble as if I razor shaved), my Titanium ones round the hair stubble when they cut and the hairs feel much softer with it at the end of the day (pleasant feel when rubbed) - with the Panasonic the stubble felt like sand paper by afternoon<br />On/off button in the wrong location, right where I normally hold my thumb, have to be careful holding it<br />Sometimes the plastic protector and screen difficult to snap back on w/o a little force<br /><br />BOTTOM LINE: Okay shaver. Would I buy it again? No. The Remington Titaniums are much better and are less expensive. Maybe I'll experiment with another brand next year. BUT the price of a shaver is NOT a good indicator of the quality of shave. Stick to what works best for your face and style.

  1341. My beloved Norelco 3 head shaver died after 11 years, so it was time to purchase a new one. I rarely get nicked, the blades live up to the average of 3-4 months, battery life is still strong and my skin stays in shape. My only complaint would be the trimmer. My previous Norelco had a solid sturdy pop-out trimmer. The other reviews of this product mentioned the same flaw: weak trimmer. However, since I do not need a trimmer that often, the razor gets a 5 star review from my end. I can only hope this razor lasts as long as my other Norelco.
  1342. While I imagine that this is a great shaver for anyone with coarse or bristle hair, for all you blondes - choose something else. Some of my facial hair, like on my sideburns, is bristly, and this shaver gets it just fine. However, any hair that is softer and more bendable, this shaver is fairly useless. I've had much better results shaving that type of hair with a regular razor or my friends shaver, one that has those 3 round rotating blade things. TL;DR If you have soft facial hair, get something else.
  1343. Like many, I'm always open to a better razor. Okay, not \\"always\\" since I don't like spending money on a razor, but in general, I will buy a better razor if I think it will give me a closer shave. For this review I'm going to try and be brief (for comparison see my review of the Norelco SpeedXL where I also mention my older Norelco just to put this review in context). I've had an old Norelco for years (I've lost count). In that time I've bought and returned 3 electric razors. Two of them didn't shave any better (both were newer Norelcos) than my old Norelco, and the other had some other annoyance I can no longer remember. Well I finally found a better shave in the form of this Panasonic! It shaves closer and faster than my current Norelco! Now I dry shave, so I haven't tried the wet-shave capability of this razor. I have only one negative to say about this razor (otherwise I would call it a 4.5 star razor): it is messy! This thing does NOT capture the trimmed stubble like my Norelco. In fact, I'd venture to say that it captures maybe 20% of the stuble it shaves. What this means is that I'm regularly doing a quick rinse of my bathroom sink after every shave (yes I clean this razor, no its not full, and yes with my old norelco I almost never had to clean the sink). Because of this it is not a \\"on the go\\" shaver. For those of you that walk around (or drive) shaving, or bring it with you when you already have your nice clothes on, beware. Lean over a sink and be prepared to leave a little stubble mess to clean--or not, up to you :D That said, I'm glad I bought this razor and my old norelco sits in a drawer as an emergency backup!
  1344. This is the fourth Panasonic wet-dry shaver I have owned over the past 20 years or more. Without question, this is the closest shaving razor yet. I shave wet with gel and this razor skims across my face with less resistant than my six year old model that recently died. It is also a bit more quiet than precious models.<br /><br />My only criticism, and this is my fault for not reading the description more closely, is that this is a direct plug-in model. My last model had a drop-in charging base that charged though conduction and did not need a direct connection. Plugging in is a bit less convenient but the new batteries last longer so charging is less frequent.<br /><br />You can't go wrong with the model.
  1345. i had always used norelco shavers. ithought i would try something else. i read all the reviews on amazon and picked the panasohic 243a arc 4 and glad i did. best razor ive had.thinks amazon for the reviews. pw
  1346. Genius! It removes the finest stubble down to an astounding level of smoothness. The kind of shave that would be an achievement with any manual razor.<br /><br />But... doesn't work on anything more than the finest stubble. If you've forgotten a day or two, it's doomed. For whatever reason, some fraction of hairs over a certain length are just never cut by the thing. So you think: hey! I'll activate the beard trimmer. Big mistake: the beard trimmer will grab and pull (but not cut) any and all hairs if you attempt to do anything other than &#34;square off the end of my sideburns&#34; .<br /><br />Here's the extra-special joy of it: the note from the manufacturer telling you that it'll take 30 days for your beard to get used to an electric shaver. 30 days. Exactly off the end of the ability to return the damn thing.<br /><br />I'd much much rather have an electric shaver that always delivers a B-minus shave instead of this one that sometimes gives an A+ shave (mostly when you don't need a shave) , but fails if you actually need a shave.<br /><br /> It fails miserably when there's anything more than the finest stubble to remove.
  1347. Bad razor for men with thick or heavy facial hair.<br /><br />It works OK; I have used panasonic's electric razors for years, but this one never gave me a close shave. If I had an evening event, I would not shave until noon, so I would look presentable at 6. My older Panasonic razors did a better job. This is definitely a middle of the road level razor; not worth more than $80 IMHO.<br /><br />My last Panasonic lasted 3-4 years, this one only lasted about 1yr. My thick whiskers against the cheap foil, equals big holes in the foil. I just upgraded to the Braun 960cc-4 ($145) and you can tell the quality difference in manufacturing.

  1362. I have never had an electric razor I liked as much as this one. I have tried many; corded, rotary, battery operated, wet/dry, pretty much any configuration.<br /><br />I usually have to go through a “transition”phase for a week or two, where my skin is irritated when switching from a blade to the electric. Not so with this Panasonic. From the very first shave, no irritation at all, just a smooth, clean, close, comfortable shave. I may have to buy stock in Panasonic :)<br /><br />I shave both my face and my head with it ... Usually in the shower, sometimes over the sink for a quick touchup. Always happy with the effortless result. It is also the first wet/dry shaver that shaves my skull totally smooth, without the need to tweak the shave here and there with a blade. That, to me, tells me I made a good choice. I may be getting smarter as I age! ;)<br /><br />Even the trimmer pop-out on the back works well. Sometimes I sport a mustache and goatee. The trimmer is a great tool for creating a nice straight line on the bottom of the mustache, getting rid of the little, straggly hairs. And, completely off topic ... why does white hair in my beard grow faster than the dark hair? Never understood that.<br /><br />I think anyone would be happy with this fine grooming tool. It is of a decent weight, and is easy to hold and use, even in the shower, and easy to clean. One caveat; won’t run when plugged in to recharge, which, by the way is very fast. Nothing is perfect.<br /><br />Hope your experience with it is as positive as mine is.

My $20 battery operated el-cheapo Braun is called more often than not to the rescue.<br />* The side trimmer is designed by a novice and must be used in only one direction to not fold back on itself while grinding the gears.<br /><br />And that fancy display? Not very smartly done either, showing charge level and other indicators for only a few seconds then shutting itself off, and blinking incessantly when fully charged.<br /><br />Nor can it operate while plugged in, so if your battery is down you are out of luck.<br /><br />In general this is an example of engineers not thinking problems through to design a good product.<br /><br />Back to Brauns.

I should add that before using this, I had a beard for several years ,mainly because I didn't like shaving. I just purchased a replacement outer foil, although it doesn't seem to need it yet after a year. My previous Braun needed this changed every 6 months.   1386. I have been dry shaving using Remington triple foil shavers for the past 20+ years. Have tried others, but always went back to the triple foil (MS3) type as it gave me the best dry shave. This shaves nearly as close as a razor blade. I have pseudo foliculitus barbae and this razor has not caused me problems desipite its very close shave. Also it does not irritate my skin. At less than half it's retail price I feel it is a good value. If you are new to electric razors vs conventional &#34;triple blade&#34; type shaves you might not love it. Electric razors take a bit more time going over areas to get all the hairs if your beard is course and lays down in places. Also the shave is not quite as close as a blade. So don't blame my opinion if you switch from a blade and don't like this razor. But if you have PFB or are used to an electric I think you will also like this product.

Eventually the shaver will get &#34;loose&#34; and begin making more noise and lasting a shorter time on a charge - signs to start thinking about replacement. Although I don't shave wet, that feature makes the shaver really easy to clean, which I do once a week before charging. I draw the line at having to store a shaver in a stand, and this unit is the best available on this side of that line.

I have used it wet and dry, and although the wet shave (with water, soap or shave cream) is smoother and more comfortable, it takes about twice as long. A dry shave, or with just a little water on my face, works well enough to get me out the door, and I get no irritation that way. I had my dad use it to compare to his rotary, and he loved it too. The battery lasts a long time, and it charges quick. I used to have to keep my old shaver plugged in the whole time because it got noticeably slower as I used it. Not true with this guy.   1426. I bought this after reading the many reviews.My husband likes it and he has a clean shave after every shave
  1427. I recommend it, so far its great. It has the horsepower, the right size head, and the ease of cleaning, and half the price of the next highest rated shaver.
  1428. This electric shaver is great for in between shaves wouldn't use this for regular shaving but its great for the a little clean up.
  1429. Previously, I always used Braun electric razors. I was hesistant about buying this, but the reviews were pretty good. After using this for about 2 years or so, I can give you my review.<br />As far as cutting and using the razor, I think it works just as good as a Braun. It's comfortable to hold and works great.<br /><br />However, I have 2 complaints about it. For one, it is VERY noisy. This is by far the loudest razor I have ever owned. Second, because the motor spins so fast, I find that I can only get about 2 uses out of it before the battery is almost completely drained. As long as you know this, it's not a big deal I guess. The digital display tells you how much battery life (in percentage) is left, so you can keep an eye on it. Also, my previous Braun razor allowed me to still use the razor when the battery was dead as long as I plugged it in. This one does not do that. So, if the battery dies and you are in the middle of shaving, you have to wait for it to charge up. In it's defense, it does charge up very quickly.<br /><br />I haven't used this as a wet shaver, but it is easy to clean because of the way the head is all sealed up under the blades.<br /><br />Overall, this is a decent razor. Would I buy it again? Probably not. I'll probably go back to Braun. I like my quiet razor.

  1437. Over the years I've dabbled with electric shavers and have never been satisfied enough to make a permanent switch to them, but this Christmas I received a Phillips Sensotouch 3D as a gift and it really surprised me. This immediately got me to thinking about picking up a new top of the line foil razor since I've always gotten better results from them than I ever got from a rotary.<br /><br />The Panasonic arc IV was highly regarded and it has a price that simply can't be beat, if you get a Braun 7 Series you'll be spending twice as much for, in my opinion, an inferior product.<br /><br />The actual shave itself was magical, the first use was a dry shave with Afta pre-electric (strongly recommend it) and it obliterated whiskers so quick I was shocked, even on my neck where foil shavers usually struggle it handled it all with ease. The result was a baby butt smooth shave that took 5 minutes.<br /><br />Where this thing really shines though is using it wet with a low lather shaving gel. Then it gets moved into a whole different realm of smoothness, it literally feels like you're not even removing hair. Using it wet also makes the shaves last longer, nearly as long as a blade shave. The only downside is it takes about twice as long once you factor in clean up and prep.<br /><br />If your trying to decide between the Series 7 and the Panasonic, go with the Panasonic. You'll save money and get great shaves.

  1489. First off, I've been a pretty loyal Mach 3 guy for a long time now. I tried a Norelco wet/dry shaver a few years back, but I dropped it in the shower and that was all she wrote. I was fairly satisfied with that unit, but man, did it tear up my neck. I had been wanting to try another electric shaver again, but couldn't really see dropping $150-250 for some of the better ones. Then I saw this Panasonic with the nano-tech blades, and tons of great reviews. I couldn't beat the $99 price tag, either. I spend that a year in Mach 3 blades easily. By the way, the shipping was quick. I ordered it on 1/15, and it arrived by USPS on 1/20. Another good job by Amazon. Anyways... I had to check it out. It's much smaller, lighter, and less bulky than it appeared in the pictures. Feels nice in the hand, too. It comes slightly charged in the box, as I found out by hitting the power button. It is a lot quieter than the Norelco I had, too. A mild buzzing. I went ahead and charged it up. About an hour later, it was flashing 100% charged. Pretty fast, in my opinion. I hadn't shaved since Friday night, so I figured why not? I didn't use any shaving cream or wet my face down. Just went right for the dry shave. It tackled my beard with no problems, other than some hairs on my neck. I usually shave twice with my Mach 3. Once to get it close, and then a second time against the grain to make it baby smooth. The Panasonic didn't quite get it to that baby smooth closeness, but it's somewhere in between. It's at least as good as the first pass with the Mach 3. Add in that I was shaving *dry* and there's the \\"wow\\" factor. I can't wait to try this with a little shaving gel. The negative? The neck hairs that lay flat on the neck. It took a few passes and a little more pressure to get them. Even then, I didn't get them all. But it was very few, and I'm sure I'll get used to how to get them. But even this negative has a bright side. Even though I putpressure on my neck, it never \\"bit\\" me. The Norelco with any extra force applied made you feel like it was peeling skin off. That was with the Nivia lotion, too. I am really amazed that the Panasonic gave me a good shave, dry, with no irritation or nicks.

  1491. The Panasonic ES8243 A Arc IV Nano is without a doubt the best electric shaver on the market. I have used this shave consistently now for about two weeks. A couple of advantages that this shaver has over the Braun Pulsonic is that the liner motor moves at a faster speed, the pop-up trimmer is more convenient and easier to use, and this shaver can be used wet/dry. While I haven't used it dry, I can say that using the shaver wet has provided me with amazing results. One thing that I'm not to happy with about this shaver is the battery life. A full charge is only good for about 10 three minute shaves. My pulsonic lasted much longer. Other than the battery life, I don't have any complaints. I purchased this shaver because I have sensitive skin that is prone to ingrown hairs and I have thick coarse facial hair. The motor in this razor has no problem cutting my hair and I'm left with smooth skin and zero irritation. I highly recommend the shaver.

  1501. Whether wet or dry this electric shaver glistens as it performs bigger and smoother than expected. I've been a Braun pulsonic 9595 user for the last 5 years and decided to give the Panasonic ES8243A a trial figuring it would cost me the same amount of money to repair and replace worn Braun parts as it would to purchase new.<br /><br />I discovered in less than 2 minutes that you don't have to spend $249 for a Braun when a $104 Panasonic will indulge you for less. I have a thick recalcitrant beard. My previous shaving routine began with a hot towel, shave cream, single blade manual, triple blade manual then an electric shaver. Braun never had enough power to tug my buttons. The Panasonic is quiet and about as ergonomically discreet as they come. It cut through my dry beard faster than any manual I've owned over the years. I experienced some razor burn on the dry shave so I decided to give a weekend's worth of growth a trial wet/cream shave. The comparison confirmed for me that a wet/cream shave with the Panasonic 8243A gives as close a shave as my manual razors without the usual razor nicks I experienced on a needless daily basis for decades. I can finally dump the styptic pencil from my morning bloodletting practice.<br /><br />Gripes: The power on/off button is problematic. In the short time I've owned this shaver, I've accidentally turned the unit off in the middle of a shave more than I care to report. The button should be located at the base of the unit -- far from busy fingers. And unless you are sporting a Pug nose this shaver does a mediocre job under my prominent Streisand.<br /><br />Praise: I'm a believer in the 8243A. I no longer own a manual razor and hope to never revisit one.<br /><br />Update: It's been about 6 months of daily use and I couldn't be happier. I've discovered that by rubbing a bar of soap in my wet beard I can achieve the same close shave had I used an expensive cream. I've now eliminated bloodletting manual shavers and shave cream making this purchase all the more practical. Now I have one less item to pack in my travel kit.<br /><br />Update: The blades are beginning to show signs of wear. Getting more tugging and skipping through my beard. No longer the glide through from day one. I can hear the motor struggle now when the cutting head hits a thick patch. Might be time for a new blade replacement.<br /><br />Update: I'm 7 months in on this shaver and the blades are badly in need of replacement -- one of the downsides to having a heavy beard. Replacement part: Panasonic WES9068PC Men's Shaver Replacement Inner Blade www.amazon.com/Panasonic-WES9068PC-Shaver-Replacement-Inner/dp/B001159UMM/ref=pd_sim_hpc_1<br /><br />Panasonic recommends inner blade replacement every 2 years -- more realistic for a light to medium beard. But at $15 for new inner blades on 7 months of use versus purchasing a manual razor, I'm still ahead in terms of cost/consumables and blood loss from dreaded nicks. Remain happy with my purchase. Only negative is poor performance under my massive proboscis.<br /><br />Update: Sincere regrets for downgrading to 4 stars today. The LED is reporting gibberish. No way to tell if the unit is functioning properly. Will contact customer service for warranty repair.<br /><br />Update: December 31, 2013...Upgraded to 5 stars since Panasonic customer service was exceptional on the warranty. I received a brand new unit expedited from their Texas facility and packaged impeccably. So happy to have this shaver back.<br /><br />Update: February 14, 2015...At the 2 year 4 month mark. I've downgraded to 4 stars. The LED is reporting gibberish once again after the replacement unit shipped a year ago. I have no idea how much shaving time I have left in the unit. 4 shaves is about average on a full charge. Still the best $100 I've spent for a shaver. Their LED is problematic. Perhaps they'll get it right on the next iteration.<br /><br />Update: At nearly the 3 year mark of ownership this device failed to recharge. Will not purchase again.

The only problem with it is that the head is a little large for shaving under the nose above thin mustaches. There is one line in the head that can and does shave longer hairs... and it will shorten your mustache! lol. But, I'm quite happy with it.
  1511. I bought this per recommendation from my brother. I use this not to shave my face but to shave my head. It works extremely well when ones hair is always kept short. I use it every 2-4 days. It cuts really smooth and really fast. Only a few minutes to shave.<br /><br />It has a hard time cutting sometimes if I grow out my hair for a week or so. I usually have to cut it down a little using traditional hair clippers at a number 0.<br /><br />Overall it does great for the purpose with which I use it. I recommend this product.
  1512. I love this razor,I have had electric razors in the past that I liked but none of them compared to this one.
  1513. My husband has never used an electric rasor but a few times before. He really prefers this one now over a manuel shaver. Much easier and quicker for him to shave. It reallly gives him a close shave! The reviews we read for this Panasonic convinced him to give it a try& he is very pleased with it.
  1514. This is a fine razor. It really doesn't have four blades. The outer two blades do the work. The inner two seem like minor blades that do very little. But the thing does cut hair very well. It has a very high RPM and does not bog down when shaving. I like it and would get another if I lost this one.
  1515. I have found this shaver to be the best I have ever owned. My last three have been Norelcos, and never again. This cuts all of the long whiskers that my old shaver would leave behind. Smooth and excellent from the first shave.
  1516. It doesn't cut the hair from bottom and you will have hard time to shave your neck and under chin, you will need to replace the blade after 3 months!!
  1517. *** UPDATE<br />I sent a written letter to Panasonic's Customer Service division outlining the issue below. I received a call back 3 days later. They offered to do exactly what I had originally suggested and a new shaver is on the way. It would have been nice if it hadn't taken two phone calls and a letter, but they did do the right thing in the end. I do really enjoy the shaver itself, and with the service issue fixed can recommend it. ***<br /><br />ORIGINAL REVIEW<br />Shaver worked fine for 11 months, then developed a problem where every light on the LCD screen stays lit all the time, so I can't tell the charge level, blade status, etc. I contacted Panasonic customer service, who said they would happily replace the unit if I shipped it to their repair facility in Texas, with an estimated turn around time of 10 business days. I explained that I kind of actually need the shaver on a day to day basis, and I asked them to send me a new unit first, following which I would return mine, which at least still shaves. I offered to give them my credit card number so that they could charge me for the new unit if my old one didn't make it back to them as promised. This procedure is common enough in business (I've done it multiple times with things like computer components) and I think was an entirely reasonable request on my part.<br /><br />Panasonic's official response, in essence was, \\"Sorry sucker. Grow a beard.\\" It's a pretty lousy attitude given that the unit went bad well within the two year warranty period. I told the customer service supervisor as such, and mentioned that in the days of social media and online reviews, it perhaps was not a wise decision to tick off a customer over a shaver that retails for $122.33 that he offered to guarantee payment for anyway. The \\"Grow a Beard\\" response was still the only one available.<br /><br />The unit does shave well, but now it's my personal mission to keep as many people as possible from buying one. Through the miracle of copy and paste I can post this review for all of their other models as well. Maybe some Panasonic representative with a longer-term outlook will see this review and be appropriately horrified that their customer service department couldn't do just one small thing to keep a customer happy. Remember, I offered my credit card number - it would have been exactly zero risk on their part. So buy this unit if you feel lucky, or if you just look really good with a ten day beard. Otherwise look elsewhere.
  1518. I have always suffered from sensitive skin and shaving every day wasn't an option. I had tried a couple of electrics a few years ago and hadn't had much luck. I like to shave in the shower and this offered that option. I also started using the shave secret oil with this instead of shave gel. I'm at the end of my first week and I cant tell you how happy I am with this product. My face is still getting used to using an electric and I know its only going to get better. I actually look forward to shaving now. No bumps, ingrowing hairs or razor burn. Buy this product along with Shave Secret and you will never shave with a razor again.

  1560. For me, this is the best razor I’ve used. I have always had soft facial skin and a blade was always too abrasive, no matter what brand or how new/sharp. There are plenty of opinions on foil razors; IMHO, the foil razor is the best razor available. The method I use is that I basically &#34;massage&#34; my face with it, passing over and over again on the same area for a couple of minutes to achieve a super close shave. This is my first Panasonic. It is a really great razor... the ONLY reason that I gave it 4 stars and not 5 is because you cannot use it while it is plugged/recharging. At times, this has been a huge inconvenience. Once the battery dies, you need to wait for it to at least partially recharge before you can again begin to shave. I've had razors in the past that I could use while plugged and if this one had that feature, it would get 5 stars. The razor has worked flawlessly for over three years, so I have no other complaints whatsoever.

The panel on the front indicates battery life, and my 6 minute shaves use about 30%, so it's not very accurate. So 3 shaves and I have to re-charge, but it charges in an hour. Great shaver.

(I will be ordering replacements soon). The battery is only showing a slight degradation, requiring a charge every 4 shaves instead of 6. Cleaning is a snap. A rinse and with soap on the cleaning cycle for 25 seconds every few days.
  1599. This is the best electric razor I have ever used. I have tried many electric razors but none have given as close a shave as this one. The fact that I can use it with shaving cream is great. So I would say if you are thinking about an electric razor this one is definitely worth trying.
  1600. Works really well, and holds a charge for several shaves.
  1601. Used this razor for a few times and am extremely satisfied with the results. Haven't tried the wet shave option, but got a very close and smooth dry shave, and that too without any irritation. The only thing that I didnt find very impressive was that I had to go over the same area for a few times to get an extremely close shave...But overall I am very satisfied with the result. Will definitely recommend this to others who are looking for an electric shaver...
  1602. My parents bought me this razor for Christmas. I have always used Norelco (with the three round circles) before and was a little worried I wouldn't like the foil razor as much. In short, I love it. I have used for about a month now and it is the best shaver I have ever owned.<br /><br />--- Battery<br />First off, the battery life is great. I am in my mid-20's and shave every day. My average shave time is about 2.5 minutes. I can go a full two weeks without having to charge it. And I love how it displays battery level after every shave so I know how much I have left. My old razors would last a little over a week. I am sure this one will get worse over time but right now it seems great.<br /><br />--- Closeness & Quality<br />I have heard people argue that the foil shavers get a much closer shave than the round ones. I think it may be a little closer but not a huge difference. I have also heard that it is hard to adjust to one type of razor if you have been using the other. This may be true if you are switching from blade to electric but I had no problems at all. No irritation with this bad boy.<br /><br />I also don't think I have to go over each spot as much as with my old razor. One or two passes and I usually get a very smooth clean finish. It handles my jawline very well also. The \\"tilt\\" head on the shaver follows the curves of my jaw and chin and face.<br /><br />--- Side burn trimmer<br />Seems small but this is one of my favorite things. It works so much better than my old razors. Clean and crisp line. Don't have to keep going over it again and again.<br /><br />--- Case and Cord<br />I like the case (nice leather pouch) but the cord is a little bulky. Not sure why it needs to be so big.<br /><br />--- Display<br />It seems nonimportant but the display is very nice. It tells you how long you have been shaving. What your battery level is, and when it needs to be cleaned.<br /><br />--- Cleaning vibration mode<br />If you hold the button it goes into \\"clean mode\\" which apparently means it just vibrates a bunch. I don't know if I can tell that it works that great but I do that and rinse it under some water and it cleans very easily.<br /><br />--- Overall<br />Panasonic makes nice razors! I love it
  1603. So far, so good. It does a great job shaving. Although I have only used it dry shaving it gives me a very close, smooth shave. I would definitely recommend.<br /><br />The only reason I did not give it 5 stars is because there seems to be an adjustment period. I normally use an electric razor but this one left my skin somewhat sensitive for the first couple of weeks.
  1604. Have bought several electric razors in the past and was very disappointed with them. I usually bought the three rotary blade ones because they were recommended by friends. I have very sensitive skin under by chin and that caused a lot of irritation. I have used this razor without any issues at all. This does a pretty good job except for his neck which I use the side burn cutter and then razor. Over all It surpasses my expectations.

  1611. I treated myself to a new electric shaver after many years and am very happy with this model. Reviews were mostly favorable and the price was right at the time. I like that after every use the LED battery indicator let's you know how much charge is left.
  1612. I was going to wait to write a review until I had this for at least 6 months, but I am just to thrilled to wait. I have very sensitive skin with fine, straight, relatively thick hair that is now about 40% gray. If you have coarse hair or curly hair, your results might differ. I also have a mustache and goatee, so I can't say how well it would work on the hair in that area. This is the fourth model of electric shaver I have owned. I started 15 years ago with a rotary Norelco that worked pretty well but caused serious razor burn. I then bought a two-bladed Remington that worked pretty well, but died with no warning after 2 years, as did its replacement. I then purchased a cheaper 2 headed Panasonic that shaved about as well as the Remingtons while causing slightly less irritation. However, as my hair got gray it struggled to cut it. I have wanted to buy the ES8243 for years but could not justify the expense when my other Panasonic was still going strong and I did not think there would be a massive improvement. However, after about 7 years the battery gradually started discharging more rapidly and had finally gotten to the point where it would only last for 3 shaves, and when the price on this shaver fell suddenly to seventy five dollars I jumped on it. I just wish I had bought it years ago! It is absolutely fantastic. It gives me a shave that is 95% as close as a bladed razor, with much less skin irritation. It does irritate me a bit more than the previous, lower RPM Panasonic, but that is because it shaves much closer. As others have noted, it works best if you do not press hard. My only complaint is that unlike my previous shavers, it will not operate while plugged in. I have bought several electronic items and other &#34;man toys&#34; in the last few months, and yet the item that has thrilled me the most is this shaver! I never would have expected that.
  1613. Smooth shave. nice razor - with all the bells and whislles.<br />iWould call it a good buy. might even be a 5 star
  1614. When I have not shaved for a while it takes a few passes to get the job done I must say I am disappointed. My old 7 yr old electric razor was much closer and better preforming!
  1615. Great shaver! Don't think, I could get anything better than this one, especially for this money (74.99$). Very happy with it.

  1617. Ordered this around 2 years back and its still working great, of course i had to replace blade once. But this is so far best shaver i have come across. Once to figure out how to use it properly then you only need 90 sec to shave. I always use it during shower with little shaving foam and it works just great.
  1618. Excellent, but doesn't work that well on the neck as compared to a traditional razor. Smooth and really precise and the extension to trim side burns is good too.
  1619. Let me start by saying what a lot of people already have: we all have different beards, so the results will clearly be different for everyone. However I still have not met anyone with a tougher beard than mine, not because I have too much hair but rather because they lie flat, grow in many different directions, and are very thick, so my only option when shaving has always been to use an electric to avoid the nicks, cuts, and irritation.<br /><br />I had always used Braun before, as a matter of fact I got my first one second hand from my dad who got a newer model and gave me his - by the way, this shaver still runs and is probably from the 80's - it was a single blade shaver but with a very strong trimmer that worked like a charm. Shaving would take forever since I had to do my first pass with the hair trimmer to lift off / cut longer hair, and then shave with the foil which was a bit irritating (no pivoting head or anything). If I didn't I would end up with patches of unshaved hair and with LOTS of ingrown hair all over my face.<br /><br />I guess I stayed loyal to the brand since my dad always used them, and since he got a decent shave I thought it must have been me then! I got yet another one from him (don't even know the model), and then upgraded to the 8995 activator in '04. This one again gave me a decent shave, provided I used the trimmer first but was a very long shave of around 7 min - it did seem that the blades would wear out way faster than my old Braun shavers though (had to replace once a year or more often). Used it for five years and decided to upgrade when it would bug down while shaving, and due to the unavailability and price of the proper foil + cutter.<br /><br />I purchased the new Pulsonic and even though it did give me a somewhat faster shave, I still had to use the hair trimmer (very flimsy by the way), and performance seemed to drop dramatically after the 2-3 week of use. I hated the fact that I couldn't hear the hairs being cut (call me crazy), and even though it felt `softer' to the face due to the pivoting + spring action, I had to pass through the same area so many times I ended up with extreme irritation and ingrown hair.<br /><br />After not being able to take it anymore, I decided to go with the competition mainly based on Amazon's reviews and I am sure glad I did! For all of you Braun users, and I'm not talking Pulsonic only but also those that have tried older Brauns with success: this is the shaver for you. Think of a redesigned Braun that maintained old foil quality + performance, added multiple blades, faster motor and you can wet shave as well!<br /><br />This shaver works extremely well, especially when shaving wet with some shave cream or gel (I use Target's brand @ $1.90 per can, works great!). It just glides effortlessly and leaves you with a very smooth shave I had never experienced from an electric shaver before. I have finally been able to reduce the need of the trimmer to a minimum and generally shave in about 3-4 min (I know this is long for some of you but it is heaven for me) - no irritation, and ingrown hairs are for the most part gone. The shaves are so close I still look decent after 5pm and have even been able to skip a day every now and then; I must say I'm doing it less and less since shaving is no longer a nightmare for me. Another interesting point is that even though it seems loud, I would say it is as loud as the Pulsonic but obviously with a higher pitch noise from the higher frequency motor, you can still hear the hairs being cut! It has not bugged down on me yet but I will keep you posted as I use it more.<br /><br />I am submitting this review after a year and a half of owning the shaver. I had to return it for warranty to Panasonic and they sent me a brand new LA-63 - review for that one will follow (outstanding customer service by the way). I must say even with its short 'life' I am extremely satisfied with this shaver and would buy it again. Amazon constantly has it for sale at under $90 price range.<br /><br />Summary:<br /><br />Pros:<br /><br />- Very effective, fast shaver<br />- Reduced ingrown hair<br />- Extremely close shave comparable to blade shaving<br />- Wet shaving option (excellent) - you can use this shave in the shower if you'd like<br /><br />Cons<br /><br />- Battery time<br />- A bit loud - I am already used to it<br />- Expensive replacement blades<br />- Durability: mine failed after just one and a half years of use. Great customer service though.
  1620. I was the owner of Braun shaving products for years. My latest was the very pricey Braun 760. I dutifully bought and used the Braun proprietary cleaning solutions (an annoying, recurring expense). I changed the screen and blades as directed. Nevertheless, it did a crummy job, particularly with neck whiskers. I had to go over the same facial areas at least twice for a clean shave.<br /><br />I finally started shopping for another shaver after the plastic side trimmer broke, and I was directed to mail the Braun to a San Francisco repair shop who would quote me the repair cost after examination of the product. Riiiight! I went shopping on Amazon and found the Panasonic shavers. I read the reviews and settled on the ES8243A. I particularly like that I can clean it with soap and water and use it wet or dry. I don't have to buy a special, proprietary cleaning fluid as I did with the Braun 760. Also, this shaver delivers a much closer and faster shave than the Braun. There was no \\"break in\\" period for my beard; I noticed the difference immediately. This shaver was less than half the cost of a new 700 series Braun. I'm sticking with Panasonic from now on.
  1621. I've been shaving with Braun shavers for about the last 15 years. Lately, it seems like nearly every \\"upgrade\\" to the latest model has resulted in longer shaving times to get the same level of closeness. A few weeks ago, I decided to risk 100 bucks, and give Panasonic a try...specifically the 4 blade ES8243A. I must say, I'm really impressed! While it was taking me 15-20 minutes to shave with my latest Braun (even after replacing the foil and blades), this new Panasonic gives me an even closer shave in less than 5 minutes. This is like an hour of my life back every week...or about two full days less time wasted on shaving every year. Hummm...I wonder what I can do with all that new-found time.?.<br /><br />My beard is thick, and grows very fast. I've never been able to use a blade because of skin iritation problems. I've never used any of my shavers wet, I only shave dry. I've tried both before, and after my showers, and the results don't seem to change much for me. Braun users, do yourself a favor, and risk the $100, and give this Panasonic a try. If your beard is anything like mine, you will be amazed at how close and fast it is!
  1622. Purchased this shaver as a gift for my husband almost 2 years ago. As a long time mach 3 blade user with sensitive neck skin, it took him 3 weeks to adapt to the new shaver. Using the shaver wet with billy jealousy shave cream he found the shaves to be very good requiring just a small amount of razor clean up in order to achieve a great shave. The display stopped working properly after approximately one year. Not a huge deal as the shaver still worked for its intended purpose. However, a bit of a pain to try and figure out when the unit needed a charge. The difficulty ranged from intermittent black-out giving no info to all LED indicators lighting up at the same time. Then, after 22 months of use it just quit. Very disappointing for a $100 appliance to stop working completely. Likely just a battery replacement is needed. But sadly, Panasonic does not sell replacement batteries. Hence the 4 star rating. 2015 update to review: Very happy with Panasonic's handling of the warranty. Mailed shaver to them and they replaced with a brand new unit within 2 weeks. Very surprised by the rapid turn-around.
  1623. I must admit that in the past and with limited funds, I broke down and purchased a lesser brand of shaver. After three months it bit me! Twice! No more razor burns, no more cuts on the jaw line and the smoothness and quietness of the unit is a great experience. At least twice a week, I pull the head, brush off the deposit of whiskers, spray the cutters, return the head and run for a few seconds and have found the to be of great help. It leaves the unit nice and clean.

I found that it would give a close shave; however I had to make multiple passes where as with my ES-LA63-S I got a close shave in just a couple of minutes. The whole purpose of me using a foil razor is because I get up early for work and don't want to spend a lot of time shaving if I can avoid it. I figured all four blade Panasonics must be about the same, but I guess I was wrong. I bought this model for $94.99 trying to replace my other one and save some money. Yes, it gave me a close shave, but I could have gotten a quicker shave using a disposable razor (which defeated the purpose).<br /> Today I sent it back and will likely get another Panasonic ES-LA63-S or I might try the new five blade. The Panasonic ES-LA63-S has a multi-flexible head which makes it pivot better to follow your contours while shaving, It also has a vibrating outer foil for one of the blades which is similar to the finishing foil on the model, just better. So, if your looking for a shave that is fast and close I would go with the Panasonic ES-LA63-S for an extra $25 dollars. If you don't mind spending more time and want to save a little money, this model will do the trick. You will just have to spend an extra 3 or 4 minutes trying to get it.

I looked and found this razor for just slightly more than the foil for my old one, which is identical to the foil on this one. I recommend this shaver. Five years before I needed blades or foil. That's good mileage.
  1670. I have had my Panasonic for 3 years and it has worked great. Last night it started turning on and off by itself and displays some corrosion inside the unit. All in all I will just by a new one...
  1671. I picked this up because after 10 years, my face is suddenly too sensitive for razors (not sure what happened). This thing comes with a slip of fluorescent paper with a big warning that begs you to try the product for 30 days before you return it. I thought that was probably a scam to trick you into going over the return policy, but it actually does take about a month to break it in real well.<br /><br />I thought it was a piece of junk the first 2 weeks and I would have to keep touching my face up with a regular razor after to catch all the spots it couldn't hit. However, after 2-3 weeks it started working really well and now I use it everyday for my face and head. It still has some trouble around my jawline but you get the hang of it after a while. The problem is that it has trouble over loose skin so you need to flex your face one way or the other to tighten it up. It's definitely worth it thought because (after the first couple weeks) it leaves no irritation behind unless you really grind it into your face.
  1672. It works well. My dad likes to use it.
  1673. I compare this Panasonic vs mach3 blades. By price, I have savings considering 1 year in operation. It is practical to use. The duration of the recharge is good, I do not have to be recharging every moment.
  1674. Panasonic's shavers do a great job when it comes to shaving. They're fast, close, and minimal irritation compared to anything else I've used. My facial hair is thick and grows fast, so the difference between shavers becomes apparent quickly. I love the way Panasonic's shavers do their job.<br />BUT - and of course there's a but - this one, like the others I've used - suffer from some sort of fatal flaw. After several months of operation, the display will start to freak out and not function properly. The button will randomly trigger on or off, especially while trying to use it. Within a couple weeks, it'll become inoperable. This has happened to me with three Panasonic shavers now.<br />I don't know if it's a matter of water getting into the circuitry, despite it being a &#34;Wet/Dry&#34; shaver, or just a run of bad luck, but I've switched to a Braun. The shave isn't quite as good, but it's lasted a lot longer than any of my Panasonics ever did.
  1675. my favorite razor. Second one i've owned
  1676. This shaver is the best on the market. This is my third shaver over a 15 year period.
  1677. There were times that I would look like a bloody mess days before a competition from shaving my legs with traditional razor. Once I purchased the Panasonic ES8243A Men's 4-Blade (Arc 4) like became easy. No more choped legs and easy cleaning. If you cycle or run and compete this is your new best friend!
  1678. This is perfect shaver, I have no complaints about it. Wet or dry - it shaves perfectly every time. Excellent value for its price.
  1679. it is a great razor but it does snag up from time to time unless 100% charged. i expected it to work better. it is nice, holds charge but i have issues once in a while.
  1680. My husband loves this shaver, his beard is course like sandpaper, and this shaver has no trouble with course hair. He says that it doesn't burn his face like a 2-5 blade razor, and shaves just as close. He is very impressed with it, and he uses it wet, as well as dry. I too was really impressed on his first shave, as his face was as smooth as a baby's bottom. When Poppy's happy, Mimi's happy!
  1681. It started off as a very nice shaver. I have never gotten razor burn from it, which was especially a problem on my neck. It sometimes has difficulty getting some areas, or maybe I just need to replace the blades. I can't say I have used it wet very often so I do not have much to say about that. It can sometimes start to smell quite bad, and when you do go to wash it out, make sure you leave it apart while you let it dry or it will smell similar to wet dog. Recently it has started to leak trimmings out while I am mid shave quite profusely, even right after cleaning. It still does a great job and is the best shaver I have owned thus far.
  1682. Still can't beat a blade. Don't like 5 hat you have to wait for a charge if it runs out of juice.
  1683. I bought this to replace a 9 year old Panasonic of similar design but with only two foils. The batteries on the old shaver were not holding a very good charge, but did last 9 years! This shaver uses LiIon batteries which are noticeably lighter than the NiMh batteries in my older shaver. The ES8243A does a better shaving job than my old Panasonic. I did find that I had to flip the shaver over when stroking in short movements because of the third &#34;fininshing&#34; screen. On my old shaver it didn't matter which way the shaver faced when stroking since both foils/cutters were the same - supposedly the angled head required you move 'forward' only, but I found it didn't matter much as long as you held the shaver perpendicular to the skin. The head/foil/cutter pivot on the new shaver was similar to my old one, but the Arc shape was new to me. The LED displays the time shaved, and after a few seconds after turning it off, the percentage of charge left. My old shaver just showed percentage of charge. I don't know why the time is important. Cleaning this shaver is identical to the old one, but the ES8243A has a high-speed cleaning mode. I use liquid hand soap which works just fine - no reason to buy a model with a self-cleaning device in a stand.
  1684. Great shaver for my husband he loves using it
  1685. I have had this product for nearly a year now. I use it in the shower daily and it still works great. I honestly think it works better on my mustache than a standard 3 or 4 blade manual razor. Also works decently on the rest of my face, but not as good on the neck.
  1686. I gave this to my son as a gift, and he uses it dry in the car between his home and work. He's really starved for free time, and he says it gives him a very smooth shave without the danger of a hand-held manual razor. He's really raved about how nice he finds the experience.
  1687. Many of the reviews for this product talked about the razor being great for sensitive skin. I have not found this to be the case. It does give a really close shave when used with the Bill Jealousy Shave Cream, but it has the same irritation effect as many other razors. I found that I had less irritation without the shave cream, but removing all of the hair was a problem.<br /><br />Long story short, If you are looking for a razor that does not cause much irritation to sensitive skin then do not purchase this razor. If sensitivity is not an issue then it is a god product when coupled with the Billy Jealousy Shave Cream.
  1688. This is indeed a great razor. I have tried many electric razors over my lifetime and have given up on them. This is the second Panasonic razor that I have had.   1689. I bought this based on its second-place finish in a razor comparison on Gizmodo, where this got second place, but has a much better price than the top finisher. I've had this for about 3 weeks and I'm very pleased.<br /><br />Pros:<br />* Cuts instead of pulling hairs, even with a few days growth<br />* Less chance of razor burn than any other I've used over 25 years<br />* Fast, doesn't take many passes to get everything, maybe 4 minutes, plus another for getting where you missed?<br />* Getting a clean, complete shave is pretty easy with little pressure<br />* Easy to clean<br />* Sideburn trimmer works well and isn't louder than shaving<br />* Sound isn't annoying (to me)<br />* Good carrying case for travel<br /><br />Cons:<br />* Battery only good for 5-6 days of shaving<br />* I wish the power cord was shorter and coiled, to take up less space (this is a personal preference, not a knock)<br /><br />I haven't tried wet shaving yet since I don't own shave cream, but I'm looking forward to it.
  1690. This works really well and keeps a close shave without irritating my face. If I let my beard grow out too long, though, I have to shave it down with a head trimmer (without a guard) first or this will pull your hair. Still, it makes the process really fast.

  1696. There is a lot to like about this shaver. First, it's not made in China! It is well made, as are most Panasonic products. I find that it misses some hairs in depressions on my neck. I eventually use the clippers to get those. The shave is not bad, it's just not as good as a razor.<br /><br />Design-wise, it's very nice. My only complaint would be the location of the power button. I am continually turning it off while I shave. For me, it's not in the best location.<br />If you want an electric shaver, my guess is this is as good as any.<br /><br />Update 05/04/2015:<br /><br />My shaver with a 24 month warranty is now about 1.5 months old. When I pulled the charging cord out of my suitcase I found the end of the cord, near the plug, had broken off. No problem, I called Panasonic. Their story is that the power cord is an &#34;accessory&#34; and not covered under warranty!
